Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasim .
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O, sons, as you will have completed this book, which is the last of the science of medicine, by its fulfillment in it, and by its expositions and by its declarations, to me it seems that you complete that for yourselves with this treatise, which is a part of the operation by hand, and is surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For the operation by hand is spread out in our land and in our times of all deprived, while greatly fearing the science of it, its practices are obstructed; and nothing remains of it except some small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which altered the most and led to those errors and misunderstandings among those whose understanding of it was closed and its force and art prolonged.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that you vivify that by the arrangement of this treatise in accordance with the way of exposition and declaration and of abbreviation; and so that it comes through the forms of the tools of cautery and other instruments of the work as though it were a preparation of the declaration, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the cause for which no good artist is found by hand in our time is because the art of medicine is long, and that its practitioner before anything be exercised in the science of anatomy, which knows the joints of the members and their forms, and the conjunction and separation of them; and have knowledge of the bones, of the nerves and of the ligaments, and the number of those, and their discharge; and of the pulsating veins and the quiet ones, and the locations of their exit from them.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And so says Hippocrates that by name is great, yet in work small, and especially in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already said of that in the introduction to this book; for who is not learned that which we have said of anatomy, it is not vacated that he does not fall into error by which men will die, as I have seen too many of those, for some are formed in this science and throw themselves from it without science or experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw a foolish and experienced doctor who pricked an abscess scrofulous on the neck of a woman, and pierced some arteries in the neck so that much blood flowed and the woman died in his arms.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who before he swallowed a stone from a man who had a process in his state, and the stone was large, and it came to him and drew that stone with a piece of the vesica, so that the man on the third day died.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I called out to extract that, and saw that by the size of the stone and by the disposition of the patient over him that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who received stipends from a duke of our land for surgery, and indeed gave to a black slave whose leg was broken by a fall; and prepared the doctor with his ignorance, extracted the fracture above the plague, with powders and splints with great tightness, and did not leave the plague to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then he released him according to his desires, and then he layed, and then he released it for several days and commanded that we unbind the bandage; and so it stayed as though the leg and thigh had apostematized, and came to perdition.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and prepared to unbind the bandage, and obtained tranquillity and ceased from his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But indeed corruption was confirmed in the member, so that I could not restrain it, and the corruption did not cease to wander in the member until the patient perished.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who perforated an apostematoid ulcer, and was open for several days, while the wickedness of it magnified with its lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause of which is that the ulcerative humor is pure of melancholic humor, then it does not come to him by iron from all over, but that there be some member in which he suffers that from all over he is hostile.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And so, sons, it is necessary for you that the operation by hand be divided into two divisions: one in operation to him who is associated with health, and in work with which there is peril in the greater dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already excused that in all places of this book in which it occurs in operation in which there is error and fear; so that it is necessary for you that you guard that and leave that, so that fools do not obstruct the way to speak and to you discredit.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And so take your arms with solicitude and with protection of God, and your patients with gentleness and with firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the better way by the grace of God to health and to laudable success, and lay the terrible diseases of difficult cure, and place your arms from that which causes you to fear, so that solicitude in your faith and in your name does not evade you: for it remains to your glory, and more in the world and lastly to your sanctities.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Gaulish already said in some of his maxims:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not heal bad diseases, so that bad doctors do not be named.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begins the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter arranged of the head into feet, in the forms of the tools and in the iron of the cauteries, and of that which is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, of lancing and piercing, and of leeches, and of plasters, and of extraction of thorns and similar to those, all headed and arranged in the forms of the tools.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, of restoration and of dislocation, and of cure of torture and similar to those; a chapter arranged of the head into feet, and of the forms of the tools.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cautery with fire and with acute medicine and remembrance of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that begins the treatise of all the book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I will say the quality of the humors of that cautery and of the pains of it, and in what disposition cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Then I say the word of the quality of the humor of cautery and of the pain of it is long and prolix and subtle by science, and secret hidden; and already of it many wise have spoken, and from it are disagreed, and to me suffices a little of the words of them, fearing prolixity.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And so I say that cautery confers with all universal disposition, which is by matter or without matter, excepting two dispositions, which are cold dispositions without matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the cold and dry disposition with matter they disagreed; for some said that cautery is beneficial to it, and others said the contrary of that, that cautery is not convenient in disease which is by quality and by dryness, for the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and convenient is that disease cold and dry be healed by that which is cauted and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And he said the contrary of that, that by cautery there is made humor in all disease cold and dry that one sees in the bodies of men, for when you compare the body of man and its humors to the disposition of fire, you rub the body of man dry.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say by the word of that, that experiment that already to me many times have discovered.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is not advisable to venture into this field unless one is already experienced and practiced in the chapter on cauterization, and has knowledge of the variety of human complexions and the disposition of illnesses in their bodies, as well as the causes of these illnesses and their accidental effects, and the span of time during which they occur.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	However, in other complexions there is no cause for fear, especially in moist and humid illnesses; indeed all doctors agree that cauterization is beneficial in these cases, and they disagree about the use of cauterization only in certain cases.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, children, that the secret of healing with fire cauterization and the goodness of it is that the fire is simple, its action affecting only the part being cauterized and causing little damage to other parts.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of a burning medicine extends to other parts, and it strongly brings on an illness difficult to cure in those parts; it also causes great pain.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, because of its subtlety and the goodness of its substance, does not do this, but rather exceeds the limits of what is permissible; and it has been proven to us through experience and long study of the art that it is true in all cases, except for those who have not yet understood the secret of using fire, and the quality of its action in the body, and its expulsion of illnesses by philosophical reasoning. If this had not been so, I would not have spoken to you freely about the secret use of fire; nor would I have explained in detail the nature of its action in the body and the method of its use for removing illnesses through philosophical argument.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, children, that they disagree about the best time to perform cauterization; and they pause during the springtime.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	I say that cauterization is appropriate at all times, because the accidental harm caused by the delay in treatment would be greater than the minor harm caused by performing it too soon; and especially if the cauterization is for painful or necessary illnesses, strong and violent ones, which do not tolerate delay because it is feared that they will become worse.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And fear not, children; only the common people and foolish doctors believe that for every illness treated with cauterization there is a specific time of year when it should be done; they pause and wait for that time to come around.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the reason for their belief is not as they think, because cauterization is not a medicine that alters the complexion and dries out the humors which cause pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	However, cauterization is superior to medicine because of the swiftness of its action and the strength of its effect, and the grandeur of its Lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that the illness will return at some time, depending on the complexion of the patient and the location of the illness, and the nature of the cauterization, and what has been prepared in the body through an excess of humors, and what has been acquired through food and similar causes; but if the illness for which the cauterization was performed was a subtle one in a part of the body with few excess humors and moisture, as in a toothache and similar cases, then it is possible that the pain will not return, although this may happen in a small way.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And the common people say that cauterization is the last resort of medicine; and they are right to say so, not because they understand it, but because they believe that there is no cure that benefits from medicine or any other cause except cauterization.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the reason for this is the opposite; and the belief that cauterization is the last resort of medicine arises when people administer treatments for certain illnesses, but the medicines they use do not work, and so at the end they administer cauterization, which benefits the patient.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And so it comes about that cauterization is regarded as the last resort of medicine, not according to the understanding of the common people and foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that cauterization with gold is better than cauterization with iron; and they did not say this because of the equality of gold and the subtlety of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the material used for cauterization makes no difference, which is not absolutely true, for I have seen that it does make a difference in some bodies, and cauterization with gold is better than with iron as they say; but when you perform cauterization with fire using gold, it is not declared to you because the strength of the fire depends on the amount of gold used, and because the gold prepares itself to receive the heat; and if the fire is applied to the gold, some laminae are formed which the artisan can see.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And so cauterization with iron must be done more gently and more carefully to maintain the correctness of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already arranged this chapter on cauterization according to chapters, and I have ordered that the feet be treated first, so listen now to what I will say about it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	On cauterization for headache pain caused by cold and moisture:
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter:
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers moisture and coldness to the nervous system, of which there are two causes; it is a cause of swelling and many rheumatic pains, called "corissa", in the parts of the head and around the ears, and many other pains, including toothache and jaw pain, and generally any illness caused by cold, such as paralysis, stroke, and similar illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The procedure for this cauterization is as follows: first, the patient's head should be cleansed with a laxative head poultice for three or four days, depending on the strength of the patient and their age and condition.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	Then he should have his head shaved with a razor, and then he should lie down on his back on a warm bed with his feet raised above his head.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	Then pause the palm of your hand over the bridge of his nose between his eyebrows.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, if the place where your finger points has become affected, mark that place with a tent and then ignite the cauterization olive; this is its form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	Then hold that over the marked place in such a way that it descends, and your hand should be pressed gently against it little by little as you turn it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	Then lift your hand gently and examine the place; if you see some of the head has been exposed, as much as the amount of bone that was discovered, then lift your hand again, and if it does not return to you with the iron, but with another one, if it is cold, between the time it was exposed to you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	Then take a little salt and dissolve it over the place for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Then hold a cloth soaked in vinegar over it, and let that remain on it until the scale formed by the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	Then heal the place with the four-part salve after it has healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And so they say that when Roman plaster is applied wet, it is better and more effective.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the bone should be cauterized within the ear, and the cauterization should be applied where some part of the skull has been removed.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	Then it is to be washed with vinegar until the blood stops flowing, and then healed.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that the cauterization should come to the end, where the bone is broken, and that it should pierce the skull until it hits the bone; this is the form of cauterization when there is a small wound:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that from that place vapors are exhaled towards the head.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	If the wound is open for a long time, it should be healed by cauterization until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I have not seen these two species of cautery at all, except in some men according to a way of fear; and leaving that aside, it is better for health, as it is, because the head is devitalized due to the solution of continuity of it as we have testified in other members, and especially when the patient's head is of a phlegmatic nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the species of cautery is more safe and better for me, and from that use and by that action health is achieved.
Capitol segon.	Chapter According.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of cauterization of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When in all the head there occurs chronic and long-lasting pain and this is prolonged in the patient, and he uses garlic and onions and caputalgar and poultices and plasters and bandages and hot stones and woolen pads and similar things, and especially if he has already been cauterized with a cautery which we have recounted and does not benefit from any of those causes, then consider that if the patient's head is of strong creation in its nature and is phlegmatic and finds great heat, then cauterize him with another cautery beneath that one a little.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	Then cauterize that on the horn of his head so that the membrane is cut.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	The membrane being cut and the quantity which we have recounted having been discovered and cauterized with a cautery in the part behind the head in the place which is called a foramen — and that is the place in which the windpipe is paused —
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And move your hand on it and do not uncover the bone because the patient will feel great pain from that unlike the pain of all the other cauterizations of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I will tell you about this cautery in its place because the cautery with which the horns of the head and the occipital are cauterized is a more subtle cautery than that with which the middle part of the head is cauterized; and this is the way to do it.
Capitol ters.	Chapter Third.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of cauterization for new non-ancient hemorrhoids.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When a sudden pain occurs in the front of the head or a spreading pain enters the eye, evacuate the head with purging medicines and administer the other cure which I have described in the reasons for diseases; and if all does not help then cauterization should be done in two ways: either cauterization with an acute burning medicine or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	But cauterization with a burning medicine is that you take an alder twig and scorch it and smear the ends of it on both sides of the head.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then cut the place of pain in the temple with a pointed lance so that it penetrates into the hole beneath the membrane and is concealed.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then press tightly on it with a bandage and leave that for three hours; then remove the alder and treat it with water and let the wound heal in two or three days, and place your hand over it while immersing it in hot water so that the spot makes blisters.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then cure that with ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you want to do this with some burning medicines which I have written about in the second treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But the cauterization with iron should be done according to this manner: heat up an iron cautery of which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a closed nail because its head is shaped like a nail with some curve and in the middle part of it there is a small protuberance.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then place it on the site of pain and hold your hand there — so that the cautery underneath is not burned  — and move the iron little by little with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of it that is burned by the thickness of the membrane just like its size and raise your hand so that the artery underneath is not burned so that there is no blood flow.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then soak a cloth in salty water and place that on the spot and let it be for three days; then place a damp cloth with hot water on it and cure it with ointment until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you want, cauterize with the point of the scalpel according to cautery, and beware of incision into the artery in this new non-ancient hemorrhoid.
Capitol quart.	Chapter Fourth.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of cauterization for ancient hemorrhoids.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you cure hemorrhoids with what we have said about the preceding cure and what we have said in the divisions of diseases, and the cure does not help, and you see by the disease that it is insufficient for it what we have said about the first cauterization with medicine or with fire, then if you ignite the cutellar cautery so that it turns white, mark on the site of pain with a line whose length is equal to its size or almost, and place your hand on one side and press tightly while you pierce the artery and let it flow into the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However it is necessary for you to guard against the continuance of the mandible which is gnawed due to chewing and that the ligament not be burned and the nerve which moves that, and that no spasm occur.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the custody and care of flow of blood from the artery that is cut, for there is danger in cutting it and especially to one who ignores what he does and is unskilled and inexperienced; let the operation be done at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will remind you of the regimen for flow of blood accidentally from the artery according to its way in your own book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see this disease that does not yield to this cautery and the patient's body tolerates it, cauterize him in the middle part of the head as we have recounted, and cure the wound so that it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you want to administer the cautery which we have said in the chapter about stretching of the artery with cautery having two points, and this cautery is better and more effective.
Capitol .v.	Chapter Fifth.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of cauterization for pains in the ears.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When in the ear there is pain due to heat and it is cured by lacractive causes and by the other cure which I have said in the division, and the pain is not relieved, then ignite the cautery and this is the one that has a point, of which this is the form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Then pierce it and ignite it and let it be borne around the whole ear as a wheel is turned or in the circle of either one if the pain is in one.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Lengthen it with the cautery of the root of the ear little by little so that you do not burn the spot with a touch.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery is of ten points in the whole ear, and that one, then cure the places so that they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter Sixth.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of cauterization for torpor.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Torpor which is cured and by cauterization it is not but of the spices that come through phlegm according to what we have said in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the species which occurs through dryness or by spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you cure that species of torpor with herbs and head-purgatives and your cure does not succeed then when you cauterize the patient in three cauteries: the first should be of the root of the ear, the second a little below his temple, and the third should be the junction of two gums.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And apply your cautery to the contrary side of the sick person, because softening only occurs on the side that is healing.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the method of cauterization is that you cauterize the patient with the cautery on the right side of the highest part of the ear, and on the temple another one, the length of which should be according to the length of the finger nail, and place your hand with the cautery until half of the amount of the size of a bean is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of cauterization, and it is specific to the knife-maker, the shape of which is described in front of the table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	But indeed more subtle is that one a little so that you see it, and that it cuts through excessive thickness a little.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the area with what has been described in front so that it heals.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Of cauterization of ancient apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is old and you have treated it as we have said and your treatment does not work and the patient has no fever, then cauterize that with four cauteries: on all the horns of his head; and with cautery and the middle part of the head, so as we have said; and with cautery in the groin.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the manner of the cautery is done according to what is written above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has been cauterized on the mouth of the stomach; and it is more behind; and it should be cured with what has been described.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of cauterization of oblivion caused by flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Give the patient at the beginning large jars and pills of the servant purgative.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Then shave the whole head of the patient, and place over his groin an ointment of cedar described in the treatise on ointments.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And apply it several times, for that is the manner of cautery.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do that according to the order which we have already said.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And if he heals well from that, then it is good; and if not, then do to him three cauteries on the back of his head, which descend from the highest part of the head to the lowest part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place between each cautery the thickness of a finger nail, and then cure the cautery with what has been described.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you think it is tolerable and the patient can take it, then do to him cautery on the middle part; and if you see greater tolerance, then cauterize that on both horns.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then cure that until it is healed; and let the cautery be olive-colored according to the form described above.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Of cauterization of parasites and softening of all the body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Give the patient purgatives for cleansing of the head as we have said; and then shave his head, and then cauterize that with cautery on the middle part of the head, and with cautery on all the horns of the head, and with cautery on the back of the neck, and with three cauteries on the spines of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the softening of the body for parasites and the patient tolerates it and the sickness is strong, then cauterize that with four cauteries on the spines of the back, and lastly with cautery until half the size of a bean is burned, and raise your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	Then cure that until it is healed, and let this be the cautery olive-colored.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Of cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epileptic is not cauterized except for that epilepsy caused by phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And so, cleanse the brain of him at the beginning with herbs and with the other cure which we have described in the division when the patient is large and tolerates the exception of the medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who does not endure the medicines, then administer warming and chewing remedies by the servant cleansing, before that for several days, with benefit of foods.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then shave the head of the patient, and then cauterize that with one cautery on the middle part of the head according to the previous manner, and with another cautery on the back of his neck, and cauterize each horn of his head.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerates it, then cauterize that with cauteries which I have said, having paralysis and softening of the body on the spines of the neck and the spines of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And let the cautery be olive-colored according to what has preceded it.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then apply the cautery gently according to this manner.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Of cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted humors and gross phlegm, then cauterize that with the cauteries which we have said in having paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is excess phlegm declining to melancholy and the body of the patient is moist, then give him to drink what cleanses his brain according to what has preceded in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then shave the head of the patient, and then make a decently twisted tallow over the circle, and then place it in the middle part of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And let the patient be seated, and let him be held by all parts.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	Then apply liniment; and it is more worthy of being boiled of old sheep.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And boil that on the fire with moderate heat by measure, which he endures when he is in it.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	Then pour that into the middle part of his head on the circle, and let him remain until it is cool.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do that with the patient in a week once a day, and let him have the other regime of him until he is healed; or if you want, cauterize that making small points according to his age, unless you have your hand with a cautery thus ordered: this is a special cautery which moistens the brain with equality.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	Then let that be wrapped in cotton wool in a bandage or in gray flannel.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Of cauterization of water descending into the throat.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When it is declared that the beginning of water in the throat through the holes which you have said in the division, then begin and give the patient to drink what cleanses his brain, and guard him from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And let that boil in a bath for a few days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then command him to wash his head, and cauterize that with cautery on the middle part of the head; and then cauterize that with two cauteries on two temples if it is the beginning of moisture in two holes, or of one side if it is the beginning of moisture in one hole.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Pierce with cautery all the veins and arterioles which are under the skin; and let the cauteries be long in that length of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	Guard against bleeding when it is cauterized; and if you see from him bleeding, stop it with some medicine, which is to you possible.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And come with wisdom which is in extraction of arterioles and with pruning of those and cauterization of bleeding of blood.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And some bones are cauterized in the neck below two bones with two cauteries directly produced.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of cauterization of old tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears from the eyes are old and have spread through the veins and arteries to a visible location on the head, and it is clear that this is caused by an excess of phlegmatic fluids, then cauterize with a cautery as we have described in the chapter on water-fever. Cauterize in the middle of the head, and with two cauteries below the temples, and with two cauteries below the bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if there is a need for an additional cautery, then cauterize on all sides of the eye socket at the top of the eyebrow with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of cauterization for a nose fetor.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you have treated the patient as we have said in the previous chapter and your treatment does not work, then prepare and give the patient enemas for three nights. Then shave the patient's head and cauterize the middle of the nose with a cautery made from olive oil.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	Then cauterize the nose bridge with two cauteries below the eyebrows, just under the hairline.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to burn the skin.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	This is the form of the cautery, or nail cautery:
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of cauteries for softening eyelids.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid is softened due to illness or humidity, then cauterize that eyelid with a lunar cautery. This is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you are cauterizing above the two eyebrows, then do so with small cauteries in a straight line, and have them extend from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery depend on the size of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press your hand too hard with the cautery, but according to how much the upper part of the eyelid is swollen.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of cauteries for the eyelid when hairs are converted to thorns and punctures the inside of the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When hairs on the eyelid become thorns that puncture the inside of the eye, there are two ways to cauterize them: with a cautery iron or with a burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you cauterize it with fire, tell the patient to look down so that his eyelashes lie flat, and then trim them, pulling them out from their roots while they are being cauterized. If the punctures hurt him, then strengthen his eyes with a bandage so that he does not blink while the hairs are growing back.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then, when they grow back and curl, place the patient's head in your lap and draw the eyelid of his eyes with a tent, marking its shape according to the pattern of a dead leaf, and let the beginning of the mark be near the hairs.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	Then place cotton dipped in white vinegar or in a mullein tea over the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	Then heat the cautery, of which this is its form:
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	Then cauterize over the shape you have drawn, bit by bit, until the surface of the eyelid is burnt and appears like a dead leaf, all appearing healthy and proper.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And a sign of your work' s success is when you see the eyelid drawn up and the hairs raised above the puncture of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then raise your hand and leave it alone for three days, and then place a poultice over the area until the scab is healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then treat that with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if the hairs return for any reason and the eyelid is softened, then repeat the cautery over that area again just as you did at first.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs are inside the eyelid, then cauterize that area until it is raised to its natural position and curled back so that the hairs do not puncture the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the burning medicine cautery is done by telling the patient to look down so that his eyelashes are flat and then trim them, pulling them out from their roots while they are being cauterized. Then the shape of a dead leaf is drawn on it.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	Then take one part powdered sage and one part live coals. I.e.: Take this mixture and make it into a paste so that it is not too dry; then spread this over the paper which was drawn in the shape of a dead leaf, and place it on one or both eyes. Place cotton dipped in white vinegar over the eye, and let the patient' s head be in your lap.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	Then hold the eye over the medicine and press it gently without hurting him until he feels the burning of the medicine, for the burning is like that of fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And when he feels the burning, then he should let go of the medicine and press it with his finger; then when the burning stops, remove the medicine and wash the eye with water. Then consider if you see the eyelid lifted as it is washed or cut, for then it is good. And if it does not return to being washed or cut, then do not put the medicine over that area again where the medicine did not take effect and there is no blackness, but wait until your operation has healed and the eye is drawn up.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	Then place a poultice over it until the scab of the burning is healed, and then treat that with ointment made from defynikon or another one so that it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you, due to your operation, to be very vigilant and careful that the medicine does not drop into the eye. And if the eyelid becomes soft after a few days and for some reason the hairs puncture the eye, then repeat your medicine over that area just as you did at first, and treat him until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	This is the shape of a dead leaf:
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	Know that men' s eyelids are diverse in size and smallness, and therefore your operation should be done according to that.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And do not take the way of certainty with one who is ignorant of this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Of cauterization for a fistula that is in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you are treating a fistula as we have said in the divisions of illnesses and your treatment does not work, then do this: tell the patient to place his head in your lap and let one of his servants hold his head so that it is not moved or shaken by him.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	Then place cotton dipped in white vinegar or in a mullein tea over the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Then heat the cautery, of which this is its form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	Which is hollow, thus in the shape of a straw or a bird' s feather, from one end where the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you see that it penetrates into the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you wish that it come out like a tent.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But what is hollow is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	Then press the fistula if it is open, and draw out of it pus and dried blood.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and extract its hardness.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then place the cautery which is well ignited over the fistula, and press it with your finger over the cautery in the nostril, so that your hand does not move or the patient be disturbed, and then place the cautery on the edge of the eye and bend it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so if at the beginning of your cautery it enters into the bone, that is good; and if not, then repeat the cautery one or two times if necessary; and leave it like that for three days, and then place a poultice on that spot and bind it with a dry bandage until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if ten days have passed and it has not healed, then place a sharp corrosive medicine on it until the bone is exposed and scrape it according to what is appropriate in its chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another method of cautery for a fistula, which some call the first: enter at the site of the fistula and plug it up, and then place in that crack a fine powder of which its formula is given in its chapter; and melt into that the quantity of half an ounce of lead; and hold your hand with the powder with good retention so that the molten lead does not reach the throat of the patient; and cover what you have placed over the throat of the patient with a poultice of yolk of egg or water, for the lead will close up the site of the fistula and heal it in a wonderful manner.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about cautery and treatment, that is good; and if not, then it is necessary to administer a nasal speculum and reduce the fistula into the cavity of the nose according to what will be given in its place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	Of cautery for a wound in the anus.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Many times fissures occur in the lips, and especially in the lips of infants.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	So when you treat these fissures with what we have said in the divisions and your treatment does not help, then light the cautery with a small knife in this way that it is wrapped:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And let its cavity be according to the thinness of the knife.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then place that gently in those fissures until the cautery reaches the root of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that with ointment until it heals.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Of cautery for a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula or on the palate or in the roots of the teeth where there is an abscess and then it becomes inflamed, and then it breaks, and then it becomes old, and becomes inflamed and a fistula is made, and you treat that and your treatment does not help, then when you light cautery according to the quantity that is received in the fistula, then place that fire into the hole of the fistula, and hold your hand so that the iron reaches the root of it, and make that one or two times; and then treat that with what we have said about treatment until it heals.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And so if the pus is discharged and it heals, that is good; and if not, then it is necessary to expose the site and remove the corrupted bone according to what is given in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of cautery of the teeth and of softening of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by humidity and the teeth are painful, and you treat those with medicines and they do not help, then place the head of the patient in your lap, and light the cautery whose form will be given below, in such a way that you place the probe over the tooth and insert the cautery quickly, and hold your hand gently so that the patient feels the heat of the fire reach the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift up your hand and repeat the cautery a few times according to what you want.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then the patient should hold his mouth open with salt water for an hour, and then spit it out, for the painful tooth is firmly closed and the softened gum is tightened and the corrupted humidity is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of cautery for toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is due to coldness, or there is pain in it, or the cure with medicine does not help, then cautery for that is according to two methods: either cautery with a cow's udder, or cautery with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cautery with an udder is that you take a cow's udder and boil it in iron, and then take the tip and wrap it around the end of a needle, and then immerse that in the boiled udder and place it quickly over the painful tooth so that it becomes cold.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat that a few times until the virtue of the fire reaches the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, immerse wool or cloth in the udder above, and place that over the painful tooth, and place a hot iron on it so that the iron reaches the cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	But cautery with fire is that you take a needle of iron or of steel and let it be in the heart of the fire until it becomes red-hot, and there is no thickness of fire that does not reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then light the cautery whose form will be given, and place that over the tooth and hold your hand so that the cautery becomes cold; and do that a few times because the pain is increased or in that day or in another day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And let the patient fill his mouth with good water and hold it for an hour, and then spit it out; and this is the form of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize in whatever way you want according to what is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the probe:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of cautery for hernia.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When hernia is of phlegm and cold humors and they are not reduced by digestion with medicines and you see the digestion of those slightly, then you light the cautery in such a way that its form follows, having two ends so that the smoke from one end comes to the other end, and place that fire on the hernia once, and if it does not help, then do that again until it reaches the root of the hernia.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the hernia is small, then place the cautery according to the quantity of the hernia, and let it be for three days and hold your hand over it with a poultice so that what has been burnt by fire is softened.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that with ointment and bandages until it heals.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the form of the probe or needle for cautery is as follows:
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of cautery for cough and constriction of throat.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humidity comes over the throat of the lung, and especially when that is due to coldness of constitution, then let the patient be evacuated at the beginning with laxative medicines, and then cauterize that after the root of the gullet in the place of spitting.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And be careful that the cautery does not reach the gullet or burn its membrane but only a little.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And cauterize that with another cautery after the joint of the throat at its last vertebra.
