Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Troops seen there flow of artery which is cut below the wound, or below the incision of abscesses or cautery of the limb, and similar things, and it is difficult to cure that.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Therefore when it happens to someone, then you put your hand on the opening of the artery and hold there with your finger until that spot becomes narrow so that the flow of blood is stopped below your finger and does not come out.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	And then place over the wound a few large olive cauteries, by many numbers, and breathe into them until they are many small fires.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	And then take from those one small or large according to the spot and the wound where the artery is broken, over that vein quickly while you have held your finger, and put the cautery on it until it is bound and restricted that blood.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the blood is expelled from the opening of the artery when you hold your finger and squeeze the cautery, then take another cautery prepared in the fire and therefore do not cease doing this one after another until the blood is restricted.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And guard yourself that you may not burn the nerve which is here, and that it comes upon the patient some other evil.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And know that when blood flows from the artery, it is not possible in those to restrict the blood, and especially when the artery is large if not by one of four manners: or by cautery as we have said, or by extraction when it is not extracted for when it is extracted its ends are burnt and the blood is restricted, or that it be bound with a ligature or with a bandage through strong constriction, or that medicines whose virtue is to restrict the blood be placed on it; and it be pressed by a poultice with decent constriction.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	But he who administers decent restriction of it by bandage and constriction with cloth or through position of burning causes and of similar things does not confer but tarry.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	But if this happens to someone and the physician is not present or there is no medicine, then open with your finger on the opening of that vein as we have said, and understand it in great constriction of it until the blood is stopped from the main part of the wound; and on the artery let your finger not be held, and over the artery let it be sprinkled with water rubbed with much coolness so that the blood may congeal and thicken; and indeed if there is need of cautery or medicine.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begin the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incision and piercing and fenestration and phlebotomy and of wounds and their likes.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Albucasis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already said in the first chapter all the illnesses in which it is convenient to use cautery with fire and medicine, and their occasions and causes, and the instruments in which they are necessary, and we have ordered the chapters from the superior part of the head until the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And I shall proceed in this chapter through that medical manner, so that it may be alleviated to the seeker; then concerning that which he has demanded.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And before I begin that, know, brothers, that in this chapter is for terror that which is in the first chapter of cautery.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And for that know that it should be in great caution, for in the operation which is in this chapter many times there is an evacuation by blood from which life is taken away by the sprinkling of the vein or incision upon the abscess or opening of the wound or purification of the wound or extraction of arrow or incision of stone and their likes.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And from all those are accompanied by fear and trembling, and in their hands death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I admonish you that upon you does not fall that in which there is a situation, for some times chance due to the methods of men with many illnesses.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And from them is he who is carried away by his illness and is easier due to him the death, and so because of the vehemence of that which finds of his illness, and because of the length of his illness, and by the illness there is fear which signifies death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And from those is he who gives to you his word and advice, you expecting with that health, and his illness is perilous.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And therefore know that you consent to him who comes to you of whom there is this manner; and your caution be greater than confidence and your greediness, and do not presume any cause over it unless by certain science which verifies it over you, and to which good success follows.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use in the curing of all your illnesses from prognosis and indication of him to whom health is converted; for in him are you aided over acquisition of fame and memory, of praise and glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	O children, God give to you his understanding and not hide from you direction and protection, for he is in his hand.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have ordered this chapter distinguishing by chapters according as it precedes in the chapter of cauteries, of the cure of the head until the feet, so that it may be alleviated to you what you demanded of that and of which you have need.
Capitol primier.	First chapter.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	Of the cure of water which is contained in the head of infants.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	Know that this illness many times happens to infants because of childbirth and when the mother stretches the head of the infant it feels light.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And some times because of hidden cause which is not discovered.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	But I have not seen this illness except in infants, and to all those whom I have seen it is brought the death, and by such it is revealed action in them.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen that an infant whose head was full of water and the head of him was always magnified until a nurse could not bear on him because of the greatness of his head, and but the humidity was augmented so that it died with fire.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this humidity or is added between the membrane and the bone, or is added below the bone upon the skull.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	Because the operation in that if the humidity is between the membrane and the bone and the abscess is slight, then know that you cut in the middle place of the head with a slit in its breadth, and let the length of the slit be two notches so that the humidity runs, and this is the form of the spatum:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And therefore if the humidity is more augmented and the abscess is greater, then are here two slits according to this manner:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the humidity is below the bone, sign of it is that you see the edges of the head swollen all around and the water is oozing when you compress it with your hand at the edges in between your fingers and it is not hidden to you.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	Know that you cut in the middle place of the head with three slits according to this manner:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	And then extract all the humidity; and then strengthen the slits with cloth and plasters; and then put on it vinegar and oil on the fifth day, and then loosen the bandage and cure the wound with tentas and unguents, and strengthen the head with equality; and feed the patient with dry food of little humidity so that the limb is comforted and healed.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	There is another method of incision which considers the size of the abscess and the collection of pus, as sometimes it is larger at the back of the head, or in front, or on the right or left side; therefore, make the incision where the abscess appears and the pus collects, and finish it in the best way possible.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And be aware not to cut any artery and cause a flow of blood, which might result in the patient's death due to that blood loss along with the discharge of fluids.
Capitol .ii.	Chapter 2.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	Of incisions on the arteries which are near the ears, called aural arteries.
Capitol segon.	Chapter 2.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When there is a wound or an ulcer on the legs or feet, and it becomes old, and medicine doesn't help, then the best cure in this case is to make an incision on those two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And thus, when you want to cut the arteries which are near the ears, first clean the area with rough cloth so that the arteries appear, and then press it tightly with some cloth; also, look for the pulse, and the places above and below the ears, because they sometimes hide in some people.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And then feel the artery with your fingers, and cut each one with a sharp knife, entering into the bone, and let it be according to the width of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you want, insert the knife under the artery and cut through it to the bone above.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And let the length of the incision be about two digits apart, because when a vein is cut, blood emerges with a pulsating discharge, which shoots out frequently.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	But if the artery doesn't appear by feeling around, then measure three digits from the ear and feel with your fingers, and insert into the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And what comes out of the blood is the quantity of wine unces., And the blood flows out very slowly or quickly, and all that is according to the amount that appears from the strength of the patient and the flow of the artery.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And consider the skull, and if something remains on the bone that causes headache, then cut it so that it doesn't cause an abscess.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And strengthen the skull with plasters and bandages, and cure it with ointments until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter 3.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	Of extraction of the arteries which are in the temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When there is a headache or ulcers caused by cold and dampness, and it becomes chronic, and medicine doesn't help, then we have experienced in these illnesses extraction of the arteries in the temples, or cauterization of those veins as we have shown.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the way of operating and extracting them is that the patient raises his hair which are in the temples; and understand the artery appears in the temple because it is shown to you by the pulse, and it is hidden except in a few people due to the strength of the pulse.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if it is hidden from you, then press the patient's neck with some cloth; and clean the area with a rough cloth or evaporate the area with warm water until you see the artery clearly.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then take the knife, which has this shape:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And press some cloth against the patient's neck, and approach from each side of the ears so that a nerve or vein appears; and bring the knife closer between those parts. And then cut it easily until you reach the artery; and draw out from there, and extract it from the upper parts until you have pulled it out from the vein, and discovered it from under the tunics.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	But if the artery is thin, then wrap it with a thread, and cut from one part according to the amount by which they are lengthened and shortened, and there will be no blood flow. Because if they are not cut, the blood won't come out at all.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And let the blood flow out for wine unces. For three.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	And if the artery is large, then tie it in two places with strong threads made of cotton or cords long, and don't allow putrefaction before the consolidation of the skull and blood flow.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And cut the superfluous part which is between two bandages; and do it in that hour or another hour.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	And if you want, cauterize it with a cautery into the bone at the place where the ends of it are cut, and it will remain in place of that work.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	And it is better that the patient has no fever or is of hot constitution; because cauterization is of those causes that help to dry up moist humors, and therefore it is better in youthfulness.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And let the extraction of the arteries that affect the ancient wound, and they are placed over it with decently made powders, and let it be cured with dry medicines making the flesh and bones heal.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if while you are operating another vein appears causing blood flow from the artery, then tie that blood with a thread or cauterize it, or press the wound, and strengthen your hand over it until the blood is restricted.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if any of those causes is not present to you, then place your finger over the vein where the blood is coagulated, and wet the area with warm water of strong heat until the sharpness is relieved, and strengthen it according to how you can.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And what is easier in extraction of an artery is that you cauterize the vein with this cautery which has two edges, because you have felt the two places with your fingers, and put them down, ignite them, until they reach the bone and cut the vein into two places, so that it is lengthened by what is between its ends, because it is not consolidated at all by this cauterization.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the shape of the cautery:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And let the sharpness of the two edges be sharp.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	But if the sharpness of two edges is better, because if they are sharp with two edges approaching each other and not cutting into the flesh quickly.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Therefore, when there is some thickness, the heat of the fire is held in them and the flesh is cut more gently.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this work is better in all works and more gentle.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And let the space between the two edges be the quantity of the thickness of the finger.
Capitol quart.	Chapter 4.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	Of the cure of acute and sour wounds in the throat.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When they are acute and sour, and it is the veins of those which are on top of the head, and there doesn't help any cause of the cure by medicine, and sometimes the face of that person turns yellow and he feels in his front as if it was a walking of ants, and the ears of him are exhausted, moist heat which is applied to them as if the hairs were known, and the eyelids are swollen by the sharpness of tears, the old ones who are experienced in the cure of those, and they call that cure with sponge.
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And you command the patient to shave the hairs on his forehead, and then make three evenly spaced incisions in his forehead according to its length.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the length of the incision falls into two parts: the first incision should be evenly spaced according to the length of the nose in the middle part of the forehead, and the second according to the length of a little movement of the tears that are in the tear gland, and the third from the other side.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And be careful of the arteries which are on both sides; lengthen your hand in the continuation of both mandibles.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And if the space of each incision is the quantity of three fingers, adjust it.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if you have a piece of prepared sponge or dry rags with which to absorb the blood.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	And insert the spatula from two acute ends, of which this is the shape of its incision:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	that is from the top of the temple to the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Excorse with that all the gum which is between two incisions with the scalpel which is over the bone, and then do the same thing with the midline incision into the second incision.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And place the spatula there and insert into the first incision again another instrument which is called a curette, sharp on one side and dull on the other.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And pause the side of that sharp against the flesh next to the gum, and the other side against the bone, and push it in as far as it will go towards the midline incision, and cut with it all the vessels that descend from the head to the arms.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	Let the incision be continued towards the gum, and then do the same thing in the midline incision into the other incision.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And after blood comes out in equal quantity from both sides, squeeze the places where the clotted blood is.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then place in each incision a piece of dry cotton wool, and apply over that powders mixed with vinegar and oil and sweet wine, so that an ulcer may not form there.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day loosen the bandage and give a large poultice of warm water or tea, and then treat that with basilicon ointment mixed with rose oil and other things so that the wounds may heal.
Capitol .v.	CHAPTER 5.V.
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	OF THE CURE OF SORES BY CAUTERIZATION AND THE ARTERIES DESCENDING FROM THE TOP OF THE HEAD.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When to someone come cauteries which are drawn and continued, and you see the veins of the patient emaciated little, and already the guarding of them is weakened, and the eyelids are ulcerated and from there hair falls out, and in the top of the head there is acute pain and consequent tension, then know through these accidents that the matter and cauteries do not come except from few veins of the parts within.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best cure for them is this: command the patient to shave his forehead, and then make an incision in that place in the middle of the forehead, a little according to its width (and begin with the incision of the left temple into the right temple; and may the incision be into the bone; and lengthen your hand from the tears of the temples which are hurt because of chewing), while the bone is uncovered.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Absorb all the blood with sponge or dry cloth, and then fill up between the two lips of the incision with dry cotton wool or with linen.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then tighten it over that with powders mixed with vinegar and oil so that an ulcer may not form there.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you loosen that and see that the ulcer is diminished, then know that it rubs the bone where the flesh begins to grow again, and then treat that with an astringent poultice which dries up the flesh, as if you take of wheat flour two parts and of rosin four parts and mix them together, and from that make a plaster and apply it to these wounds from the flesh.
Capitol .vi.	CHAPTER 5.VI.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	OF THE CURE OF THAT WHICH CAUSES SORES IN THE EARS.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	Every cause which causes sores in the ears is one of four kinds: either it is mineral stone or similar to stone, as iron and glass; or from plant, as celery or bean; or fluidic, as water and sweet wine and their likenesses, or some beast.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And therefore when stone causes a sore in the ear or some other cause similar to those which do not increase it in the ear, and the ear is turned towards the sun, and if you see the stone, then distil into that some cause of oil of violets or sizami, and then administer its extraction, and make him sneeze with a sniffing motion, and stop up the nostrils because of the sneezing.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And then place in the circle of the ear some pieces of cloth or wool, and extend the ear towards its ends, because many times it is pierced by these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is not pierced, then administer its extraction with the instrument called a subtle hook for which this is the shape:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is pierced by the hook, well and good; but if not, then administer its extraction with a subtle needle of few folds.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And therefore if it is not pierced by that, then make a tube of brass and insert the end of the tube into the hole of the ear, and close around the tube with wax and softened oil so that nothing else may be open except the tube.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then extract by your mouth with a strong吸引, because many times things are carried along with that which we have recounted.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	But if it is not pierced in that manner, then take a piece of hollow reed or of a hollow vessel with which are pressed the ears, one finger's length, and place that in the end of the ear, and then wrap around that decently placed gauze.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And then insert that into the hole of the ear with ease, and then dry the ear from its moisture.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And therefore if it is not pierced by all the causes which we have recounted, then you cut away that in front so that it may not form an ulcer or a spasm.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the manner of cutting away that is that you first cut off the blood vessels of the sephasic vein and extract the blood according to the nature of it, and then do that cutting between your fingers and turn the ear towards its ends, and make a little incision in the edge of the ear because of the greys of it in the place which was pressed by it.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And let the incision be in the shape of a crescent so that it may come to the stone; and if the stone is hard, stop it with appropriate instruments; then close up the incision at that time with speed, and treat that so that it may heal.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause is in the ear from one of the graces which grow and are inflated, then administer its cure and extraction; but if it does not obey your command, then take a slender spatula according to this shape:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	and administer with that the incision of that grace which is fallen in the ear.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not do that when you think it is already wetted by the vapor of the ear; place that in several pieces, and then extract from those with pincers or with a slender hook, or cut it away as we have said before, because the extraction from it is eased.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But if the water which has entered the ear, due to the yawning of the patient, is not expelled at the beginning and fills his ear with some old cloth, and he spits on that ear in which there is water; and if it is expelled, well; but if not, take small stones according to the length of the finger, and warm them in the fire a little, and let the patient insert one of those into the hole of his ear, and suck on it with his own mouth from that side, and strike with another stone on the stone which is in the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Do this until all the water is expelled.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc .i., e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And if the water is expelled in such a way that you take paper or linen, and put one end of it into the ear and extend the other end with fire until its middle is burnt.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And then put in another piece of linen and do this as many times until all the water is expelled; and put on that a cannula as it has been said about the stone extractor.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	But in the extraction of an insect entering that ear, if it is a small thing, pierce and treat it as we have said in the division; but if it is a large thing which causes apoplexy, then administer its extraction with tweezers and nails, and the cause of it is farther away from all other causes that enter the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But in the extraction of a worm engendered in the ear, when you treat it with what we have said in the division and in the tract on distillation and you do not achieve a cure, then you should look at the ear towards the sun.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore if some cause of the worm appears, then extract it with tweezers or with fine nails; but if nothing appears, then take a cannula, tightly bound below and ample above, of which this is the shape:
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	And insert the slender end into the ear according to the amount which the patient can endure; and then suck strongly with it, doing this several times until all the worms are expelled.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if he does not obey you in this, then stop up and seal the opening of the cannula with wax as we have said; then administer distillations which have already been tried by the ancients in the cure of worms, and you will find them in the tract on distillation.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And let your effusion with which you pour the medical oils into the ear be through this instrument of which this is the shape:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make it of silver or brass, tightly bound below and flat above, with a small hole in it.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And therefore it must be as if it were plastered to that which is in the cavity of the cannula of containing.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you wish, take the rod and wind the end of it with a cloth decently; then pour oil into the cavity of the instrument, or sap of some herb, or whatever you wish of these medicines into the cannula — and that is in the ear — then insert the rod with cloth above it and squeeze with your hand that cloth tightly until the oil is expelled from the cavity of the instrument so that the patient feels the oil inside.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And what has been poured into the ear must already be warmed by fire a little.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And beware that the cause which you distill in the ear is not too strong, for the medicines of the ear do not endure that.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	On the cure of inflammation of the ears.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Some children are born from the bellies of their mothers not-perforated, and this happens in some men, inflammation in the middle of the ear due to pus or due to meat stuck in that; and this inflammation sometimes occurs in the hole of the eardrum which does not affect the brain, and sometimes it is in the external parts.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which occurs in the middle of it, which does not affect the brain, is in the major dispositions of difficult cure.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in that in which you achieve the brain, you should hold the ear of the patient towards the sun and look at it.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore if inflammation is apparent, open that with subtle spatula of which this is the shape:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the end of it in which there is a small breadth, of which one party be acute and the other not; and let the spatula be of two edges smooth so that it does not harm the ear.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And if the inflammation is due to flesh born in the ear or in the middle of it, then open that with subtle nails and pierce it energetically until all the flesh is torn.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the inflammation is in the eardrum, then take a slender rod of brass and warm it in the fire a little, and then insert that in the middle of the ear.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And therefore if you have sensed inflammation with that which the patient feels with ease due to the gravity of hearing, relieve the pressure of it with ease; and beware that you do not harm the nerves of the ear.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then hold to the ear cloth of linen according to the quantity of the breadth of the hole which you have wound in Egyptian ointment; and do this for several days until you are certain of the hardening of the plaster, or take some and soak that in water and sprinkle it over that after it has been ground and use it; and if you see the ear already pustulated, then beware that you remove that which you have wound in cloth and replace that with another cloth which you have wound around cerot that is made of rose oil, until the pustule scabs away; and then cure that until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	But if blood flow occurs, then soak sponge or cloth in cold water and hold it to the ear; and use the other cure which constricts the flow of blood, which is said in the tract on distillation.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	On the cure of athecal which causes dimness to the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Athecal which causes dimness to the eyelids of men sometimes moist, and sometimes dry.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore hold those with tongs or with nails, and cut those with spatulas of their roots, and then hold it to the places ground.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	But if pain with flow of blood comes, then cauterize those with a small slender cautery.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cauterization is then to cut off and to return the incisions several times when any cause of them remains; and when they are cauterized with fire, those roots are burnt and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	On the cure of grandeyssa which comes to the eyelids of men.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Many times it occurs in the eyelids of men some cause which is similar to grandeyssa in its strength and hardness, and therefore grandeyssa is called.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is an accumulation of dense humidity in the eyelid below and above.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	And the appearance in them is that you should consider if the grandeyssa comes from that which appears of the eyelid and is swollen in all parts; and the cause of it is distant.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Therefore open that with a slit through the breadth, and then dig that in all parts with ease until it drains, and then hold that with tongs and cut off that.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if you are not prepared for the beginning of it except that you penetrate the eyelid with the incision little by little, then this is not noted in any cause.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the wound is large, then you stitch it up, and cure that within which is healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, then you shall not be harmed through it because the blood of it heals itself and becomes flesh again.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the growth is declining towards the inner parts of the eyelid from within, then cut off the eyelid and suspend the growth with a thread; another option is that you make an incision, and press it from all sides, and if the eyelid is elongated by incision, then this is not noted in any cause.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	Then wash the wound with salt water, and cure the site so that it heals within.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	Of the cure of an ulcer in the eyelid above the wound.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Ulcers are grey in color and are engendered in the membranes of the eyelid from above, and mostly affect infants, aggravate the eyes of those and cause pain to their sight because of it; and they cannot bear to look at the brightness of the sun because of this.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And because of this they always squint their eyes, and sleep with their eyes closed; and so the eyelids are humid beneath the eyebrows, which have already been covered in inflammation, and the imminence of growth is apparent in the eye; and when you press on the location with your fingers, you feel growth within them.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	And some type of operation is performed on the patient who rests his head in your lap, and you prepare a cloth and make him take a hot bath, and make a circle according to the quantity that contains arternach from all sides, and then place that over it and press with your fingers all around so that growth may be brought together within the circle; then pierce in the middle of that humid area with a spatula through the incision made in flabotomy, and the incision should not be larger than the incision made in flabotomy.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	But in the anterior cowl, you must split the membrane all the way through so that you arrive at the growth, for in the most disposed processes, the growth comes through the incision according to the form of whiteness.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Then pull it out with cloths which you have wrapped between your fingers at the outer edges and revolve between the right and left hand until it is released.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And be careful that you do not pierce into the wound with the spatula so that with the spatula you may not come to the wound and loosen it.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	But if you do not encounter arternach at the beginning of the incision, but you pierce into the incision a little with ease so that arternach may process; then pull it out as we have said; and then moisten the cloths in water and wine and place them over the site and tighten those with poweder.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And so that salt is scattered and placed in the cavity of the incision so that what remains of that humidity.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then cure it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	But if an ulcer occurs in the site, then cure that with soft bandages until it is healed.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	Of manners of touching the eye.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When within the eyelids of wounds are born beneath the natural hairs and are drawn out, then these touch our eye and make manners of illnesses thus with constant tears and softening of eyelids and membrane so that this is cause of destruction of the eye which is called tactinir of the eye, and it is cured in four ways: or by cautery with fire; or with acute medicine according to what was said before in the chapter on cautery; or tactinir is made through incision and suturing; or with reeds according to how he will direct.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	And then place the patient's head in your lap; then lift up the eyelid of the eye with your left hand, and if it is lifted, all is well; if not, insert a needle into that from which pus flows beneath the eyelid, and make the needle penetrate above with the eyelid, and this must be close to the margin of the eyelid where the hairs grow — close to the hairs — and pull the needle towards the upper part of the eyelid, and lift up that with the eyelid, and convert it towards the nose.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	Then pierce into the inner part of the eyelid from beneath the hairs with a spatula of the major tear duct into the minor tear duct; then pull out the fiel and place beneath the eyelid small balls of cotton or cloth, and then mark over the eyelid with tenting, and let it be thus with the form of a leaf of mirt.
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	But however, let the form be according to the amount of elevation of the eyelid, for that is diverse in men, for from those it is required that there be a great quantity inscribed on the eyelid according to the quantity by which the eyelid is softened.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	Then pierce with the spatula over the two lines which you have marked, and commence from the major tear duct into the minor tear duct.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	And if your incision is close to the natural hairs thus with the thickness of a hair.
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	And then place the thread in one of the two angles of the membrane, and then excoriate it all, and then tie with the suture the two lips with a gum or fine woolen thread, and wipe away the blood, and make adhere what superfluous of the membranes above two eyebrows with some causes viscous, if you wish to do so, and if not, you will not cure.
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	Then let the suture of the membranes be three or four days, and then cure it.
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir.	And if you wish, remove the plaster after its suture, and cure that with what dries and tightens, for the eyelid is raised because of the sealing of the plaster and the gathering of it; but the suture is better. And therefore we say thus to the ancients of tactinir.
Mays empero en lu sia sollicitut sobre le malaute, e es de bona operacio, e no es en lu temor.	But however, there be solicitude over the patient and it is good operation, and there is not fear in it.
E es autra manieyra en taxmir, e es que senhes sobre la palpebra figura ayssi cum fuelha de mirt, e aprop eleva la palpebra am tres uncis segreguatz e congreguatz segon aquesta forma:	And there is another way in tactmyr, and it is that you mark over the eyelid the form thus with a leaf of mirt, and then lift up the eyelid with three segregated and gathered hooks according to this form:
Mays si no es possible aquo, tener les uncis, e aquo no es engualhat, lahoras pren una agula en la qual haia fil e met aquela en le mieg de la figura, e entromet le autre fiel prop le lacrimal major, e·l fiel segon prop le lacrimal mendre, e ajusta entre les tieus ditz les fiels am equalitat, e aprop am aquels eleva la tua ma am elevacio engual, eleva tota la codena sobre la qual es senhat ayssi cum havem recomtat.	But if it is not possible with the hooks, and that is not gnatched, then take a needle in which there is thread, and place that in the middle of the figure, and insert the other fiel close to the major tear duct, and the fiel according to the minor tear duct, and tie between your fingers the membranes with equality, and then with those raise up your hand with equal elevation, raise all the membrane over which has been marked as we have recommended.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then tie the two lips of the plaster with a suture and cure that until it is healed.
Mays si accideys apostema deves la tua inscizio o la tua fissura, seda aquel apostema am cerot e a lu semblantz, e am enguentz.	But if an ulcer occurs because of your incision or your piercing, treat that ulcer with cerate and its similars, and with unguents.
E alcunas veguadas endeve a la palpebra que·ls sieus pels sian convertitz, adonc cove que tu uses en aquela de aquo que havem dit de inscizio; mays sutura en quascus es mays artificial.	And some times the eyelids are drawn towards their hairs, therefore use in that what we have said of incision; but the suture in each is more artificial.
Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:	Tactmyr with reeds is according to this form:
e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	And it is that you lift up the eyelid and split the figure which is within according to what is recounted; then with art make two reeds or two astles of which the length be according to the length of the eyelid, and the width of those be smaller than the width of the spatula.
E tu ja has inscidit en las extremitatz de quascunas partidas, la on tenes les fils.	And you have already cut into the ends of each part, where you have the threads.
Aprop agregua quascuna am subtilitat subre aquo que superflueys de la palpebra del huel, e constres las cannas de quascunas partidas am fort strictura, e layssa aquela per alcus jorns, quar la codena per la strictura morira e sira denegada e se poyrira entro que per si meteyssa cayra.	Then add each one with subtlety below what is superfluous on the eyelid of the eye, and constrict the canals of each part with a strong constriction, and leave it for several days, because the vein will die by constriction, turn black and rot within while it falls out on its own.
Mays si es tardat, lahoras trenca la am las toroyras, e aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanat.	But if it is delayed, then break the vein at the temples, and apply a poultice over the wound until it is healed.
Donc cum es solidada, la palpebra es elevada e les pels no pungo.	Thus when it is solidified, the eyelid is raised and the hair does not sting.
E aquesta es la forma de doas cannas las quals faras segon aquesta forma:	And this is the form of two canals which you will make according to this form:
e haia la quantitat de la longitut e de la latitut ni mays ni mens.	and have the quantity of length and breadth neither more nor less.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter .xii.
De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	Of the pustules that come from the head and of their remedy.
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil.	When they are non-natural hairs, tough, rough and stinging the eyes, then the operation on them is that you take a thin needle and place it in that vein of fine thread and lion, and then tie the ends of it very finely.
E sia la longitut dels fiels de quantitat de una palma.	And let the length of the hairs be a palm's quantity.
E aprop tu compon2 autre fiel subtil dejos lu en breu, e nuza las extremitatz de aquel si tu·t vols.	And then you twist another fine thread beneath it quickly, and tie the ends of that if you wish.
E aprop pause le malaute le sieu cap en le tieu se, e sia prop del solelh per que la tua obra sia declarada, quar es operacio subtil e menuda.	And then place the patient's head in your lap, and be near the sun so that your work is revealed, for it is a subtle and delicate operation.
E aprop intromet la agulha en la razit del pel ajustat la qual ha necessitat de engen, e fay aquela penetrar en la palpebra festinantment entro que extraguas aquela desus le pel natural.	And then insert the needle into the root of the hair which needs skill, and make it penetrate the eyelid hurriedly while pulling that one out above the natural hair.
E aprop tire le pel entro desus e intromet aquel en alixati, e sian les pels un o dos o tres e no mays.	And then pull the hair out from above and insert that one into the lye, and let there be only one or two or three hairs and not more.
E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	And then pull your hand away so that the hair is pulled out by the lye in the eyelid with the natural hair.
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.	But if it is pulled out by the lye and not pushed out, then pull the lye to the sides below with the thread which you have tied so that in being pushed out, the lye of the trave is above.
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And wash that with the vision of the eye, for then you will pull out the lye and the thread, and cut each and close the eye, and leave the cuts for two or three days, until the hair adheres to its place and grows good flesh over it.
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.	And if the hair is longer, then tie a long one of the natural hairs, and it is elevated with that one, or the thread which you have tied so that in being pulled out, it is elevated to some space, and then you elevate that one.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter .xiii.
De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	Of the elevation of stinging hairs in the eye when the hair is very fine and delicate.
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz.	When there comes in the eye a pustule and there is contraction of the eyelid when it is drawn to one side or the other, by bad consolidation of flesh or by sectioning or cauterization, and it is called leporina, and this pustule or it is natural or accidental, and it is made by consolidation of flesh or of sections or cauterizations, or by similar ones to them badly cured.
May la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que tu fendas aquela consolidacio e que separes las labias de lu, e pauses en lu en aquo que es entre aquelas una meca de drap de li, e ligues aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	The manner of the operation on it is that you split that consolidation and separate its lips, and place in it what is between those a piece of linen thread, and tie those so that they are healed.
E no cove que tu uses de curacio de lu de las causas las quals exsiccan, constrenho; quar si tu fas aquo retorna alixacratir pus mal que nulh temps no foc habantz.	And do not forget to use in its cure of the causes which dry out, constriction; for if you do that, it will return pustule worse than at any time before.
Usa en aquela de causas que mollifico ayssi cum es fenugrec, e embroca am la aygua en la qual son coytz altea e semensa de li, o enguent dyaquilon, le qual sia liquefayt am alcu dels olis, e submergeys en aquel la meca, e cura am aquel.	Use in that one causes which soften, like fenugreek, and cook with the water in which there are seeds of hemp, or unguent of diaquinon, which is liquefied with some of the oils, and soak in it the piece, and cure with it.
E lo tesaur de la tua curacio es que tu perforsses am tot engen que no sia consolidat segon la forma que foc al comensament.	And the secret of your cure is that you pierce with great skill so that it is not consolidated according to the form that it was at the beginning.
E aquesta operacio la qual havem dita, no es sino alcuna rectificacio de ehalixacrati que no retorna la forma del loc segon que foc denant.	And this operation which we have said is not anything other than a rectification of ehacratir that does not return the form of the place according to what it was before.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter .xiiii.
De la cura de ehacrati le qual es fayt en la palpebra dejos.	Of the pustules that come from the head and of their remedy.
Aquesta alxacrati la qual es fayta en la palpebra dejos, la qual es nompnada vertadierament alxacrati; e es de lu alcuna natural, autra accidental.	This ehacratir which is made in the eyelid below, which is properly named ehacratir; and it is of one natural, another accidental.
Mays accidental es fayta per plagua o per scissura o per cauteri o per autres semblantz.	But accidental is made by flesh or by sectioning or cauterization, or by other likenesses.
E la via de la operacio de lu es que tu prenguas una agula en la qual haga fil doble, e fiques aquela en la carn, e que la fassas passar del lacrimal de senestre entro al lacrimal dextre, entro que·l fil pervengua en las doas extremitatz de la carn.	And the way of the operation on it is that you take a needle in which there are two threads, and put that in the flesh, and make it pass from the tear duct of the left into the tear duct of the right, until the thread comes to both ends of the flesh.
E aprop exten la carn a las partidas desus am la agula e cus aquela am la agula, e inscideys am spatum ample.	And then extend the flesh to the sides above with the needle and cut that with the needle, and insert it with spatulum ample.
E donc si retorne la figura de la palpebre segon que cove, bo es; e sino, pren le ray e pausa aquel en la figura fenduda, e am aquel converteys la palpebra, e fen las doas fissuras en le latz de la palpebra dejos.	And then if the shape of the eyelid returns according to how it should be, it is good; and if not, take the needle and place that in the split figure, and with that turn the eyelid, and split the two fissures on the side of the eyelid below.
E sian las extremitatz de las doas fissuras de dos angles de la inscizio, la qual has fayta entro que concurren, e sia de lor fayt angle entro que quan se congreguan sia fayta figura de lor.	And let the ends of the two fissures be two angles of the incision which you have made so that they meet, and let an angle be made between them when they come together and a figure is made from them.
E aquesta figura es letra greca: la landa.	And this figure is Greek letter: the delta.
E aprop osta la carn aquela per la quantitat que es le latz de lu agut dejos de lu, aquo que siec la palpebra.	And then push that flesh in by the quantity that it is the side of it beneath it, which cuts the eyelid.
E aprop ajusta las partz seperadas e cos aquelas am le fil de lana; e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit de las medicinas mollificativas e de las calguas entro que sia sanat.	And then tie the separated parts and sew those with the thread of wool; and then cure those with what we have said of the softening medicines and of the poultices until it is healed.
E si alxacrati endeve per fissura o sutura o cauteri, lahoras cove que tu fendas am fissura plana sobre les pels de la palpebra segon que es precedit.	And if ehacratir comes through sectioning or cauterization, then split it with a flat incision over the hairs of the eyelid according to how it precedes.
E aprop separa am la calgua entre doas labias segon que havem dit.	And then separate with the poultice between two lips as we have said.
En la suma del sermo de la cura de alxacrati quan es desus o dejos, que corra en lu operacio, segon que es preparat de la forma de alxacrati, e aquela es en forma de motas diversitatz.	In the sum of the speech of the cure of ehacratir when it is above or below, let the operation run in it according to how it is prepared of the form of ehacratir, and that one is in form of many diverse shapes.
E le artifexs savi totz temps prepara engen en quascuna manieyra la qual es possibla a lu entro que fassa retornar la figura a la forma natural, o prop de aquela, e aquel malaute segon que a lu conveneys de la operacio e dels strumentz en las majors disposicios.	And the wise artisans prepare skill in every way which is possible to it so that it makes the figure return to its natural form, or near to that one, and the patient according to how it agrees with the operation and the instruments in the best dispositions.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter .xv.
De la adherencia de la palpebra am la conjunctiva o am la cornea.	Of the pestilences that come from the head and of their remedy.
Quan accideys aquesta consolidacio a motz homes enayssi que sia solidada la palpebra pus desus am le album del huel, e sia prohibida de la facilitat del movement e de las suas obras naturals, donc cove que tu entrometas la extramitat del ray dejos la palpebra, e eleva en sus aquela, o exten aquela am le unci.	When this consolidation happens to many men who are so young that the eyelid is very solid above the white of the eye, and it is prohibited from the facility of movement and of its natural works, then insert the end of the needle below the eyelid, and elevate it on that one, or extend that one with the unguent.
E aprop tu inscideys la adherencia am spatum subtil, le qual no sia am acuitat de las inscisios, habantz obtus un petit per so que·l malaute no sia inquietat deves la operacio, e remau le spatum que no ledesca le huel am la sua acuitat.	And then insert the adhesion with spatulum subtle, which is not at all acute from the incisions, and let the patient not be worried after the operation, and remove the spatulum which does not irritate the eye by its acuity.
E sia la tua inscizio quays excorjan aquela adherencia am facilitat entro que sia retornada la palpebra segon la sua forma natural e que sia sanada tota la adherencia.	And it should be your intention to cut away that adhesion with ease so that the eyelid may return to its natural shape and all the adhesion healed.
E aprop tu met en le huel aygua salada am la qual tu laves; o distilla en lu de zunia dissolvut en l’aygua.	And then you should put in the eye a saline wash, or distil on it a solution of vitriol dissolved in water.
E aprop separa entre la palpebra e l’huel am calgua de li, e pausa sobre le huel lana infuza en album de huou, e aprop le tertz jorn usa de causas consolidativas entro que sia sanat.	And then separate the eyelid from the eyeball with tweezers and place over the eyeball wool soaked in white of egg, and on the third day use solidifying remedies until it is healed.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
