De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	Of incisions around the nail and the fleshy protuberance of the tear ducts.
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu.	Know that there are two kinds of nail: one is nervous and resembles a thin hard cipolla; the other is non-nervous, resembling a white congelated humidity which, when pierced by an iron, either takes on a red color and is not removed from it, or is cut out and the iron is not left in it.
E amdos las specias no comensan sino del lacrimal major entro que va petit a petit que cobre la vista e prohibeys le lum e·l movement de huel.	And both these conditions do not improve except by means of the larger tear duct, as it gradually covers the sight and blocks out the light and movement of the eyeball.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en la inscizio de lu es que·l malaute pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop obre les huels de lu, e eleva la palpebra am la tua ma, e aprop colligeys la ungla am onci de pauca duplicacio e exten aquela a las partidas desus.	The manner of making the incision is for the patient to rest his head in your lap, opening his eyes and raising the eyelid with your hand, then taking up the nail with a pair of tweezers, pulling it gently upwards from above.
E aprop pren una agula e entromet en aquela un pel de cavalh o de buou o de vaqua, o de semblantz, o de fiel fort, o duplica la extremitat de la agulha petit a petit e fica aquela en le mieg de la ungla, e penetra aquela am la agulha, e lia am fiel la ungla; e exten aquela a las partidas desus, e excorja am le pel le latz de la ungla lo qual siec la pupilla.	And then take a needle and thread it with a hair of horse or ox or cow or similar, or a strong gut, doubling over the tip of the needle several times, and pierce the nail with the needle, binding the nail with the thread; pull the hair upwards from above and cut off the hair at the tip of the nail, which is causing the pupil to be affected.
E ayssi tu sieguas aquela am le pel entro al derier de lu.	And in this way you should draw it through to the back of the eye.
E aprop tu inscideys le romanent en la razitz del lacrimal am spatum subtil o am petitas forfexs, e leysa la carn del lacrimal natural per so que per inscizio de aquela no endevengua fluxs de lagremas continuabla.	And then you should incise the remaining part in the root of the tear duct with a fine spatula or small forceps, and cut away the flesh of the tear duct naturally so that it does not produce continuous tears as a result of the incision.
E alscunas vetz la ungla am le sol onci estenduda o am fiel, ayssi co havem dit, e aprop sia excurjat am spatum leon del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And sometimes the nail is extended only with the iron or with thread, as we have said; and then it is cut away with an iron spatula of which this is its form:
E guarda te que am le spatum no toques la tunica cornea e que avengua en lu ruptura, e que la pupilla sia perforada.	And take care not to touch the cornea with the spatula and cause rupture, and that the pupil be perforated.
Aprop la inscizio geta en le huel un pauc de sal trissa o di cief fayt de siniar, e leyssa aquel entro al autre dia; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	Then pour into the eye a little ground salt or vinegar made from wine lees, and let it run out the next day; then wash the eye with water until it is healed.
E si la ungla no es nervoza e no podes metre la agulha, ni es ficada en aquela le onci, lahoras motas veguadas aquesta specia de ungla es curada am medicinas, e es sanada ayssi cum yeu e recomtat en la divisio.	And if the nail is not nervous and you cannot insert the iron or thread it, then this kind of nail is cured with remedies, and it is healed in the same way as an eye that has been cut, as will be described below.
E si tu vols inscindir aquela, lahoras tu obre le huel del malaute e pren spatum subtil leon de freul acuitat segon aquesta forma:	And if you wish to incise it, then open the patient's eye and take a fine iron spatula sharpened according to this shape:
am subtilitat.	with thinness.
E si vezes que aquela es rarificada e es confugida e empren en aquela razit, lahoras distilla de la tua ora en le huel de cief fayt de siniar o am cief rog o am sal trissat, e opila le huel entro a l’autre dia.	And if it is enlarged and has retreated into the root, then distill wine lees or vinegar made from wine or rose water or salt dissolved in water into the eye, letting it run out the next day.
E aprop itera sobre aquela la operacio entro que sia remaugut tot aquo que es de lu, sino que·l contrari apostema caut sia en le huel, quar lahoras tu leyssa aquela, e cura al comensament la apostema entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat the operation until everything that is of it has been discharged, unless an ulcerated pustule appears in the eye, for then you should let it discharge and heal at the beginning by applying the remedy until it is healed.
E aprop itera la tua operacio sobre aquela am razo entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat your operation on it with caution until it is healed.
La emenencia de la carn lacrimal, si notz en le huel per gran nocument, sia suspendut am onci; e inscideys aquela de aquela una partida, e no ultimes la inscizio per so que no inscidesqua fluxs de lagremas.	The fleshy protuberance of the tear duct, if noticed in the eye causing great harm, should be suspended with an iron; then incise it from one side, not finishing the incision so that tears do not flow out.
E aprop distilla en le lacrimal cief rog e fayt de siniar entro que sia sanat.	Then distill wine made from grape must into it until it is healed.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De inscizio de alguazardenic e de aquo que es nascut de carn ajustada en le huel.	Of the incision of the white of the eye and what is born of flesh compressed in the eyeball.
Alcunas veguadas en les huels de alcus es nascuda carn roga, e es sobre-pausada entro que cobre la pupilla, o apropinqua o estrenh sobre las palpebras e fort leu comprem las palpebras a las partidas deforo e es assemblada a roza de balaustra.	Sometimes in the eyes of some is born red flesh which covers the pupil, or it approaches or presses upon the eyelids and strongly compresses the eyelids against the edges outside and is attached like a warts.
Mays la operacio en lu es que·l malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se; e aprop obre les huels de aquel e colligeys tota aquela carn am oncis convenientz ad aquo, e te aquo am una forcep o am cesti; e aprop inscindiys la carn el comensament entro que tot sia finit am le encisori, e guarda te del huel que no ledescas aquel deves la tua operacio.	But the operation on it is for the patient to rest his head in your lap, opening his eyes and taking up all the flesh with convenient tweezers or forceps; then incising the flesh at the beginning until everything is finished by means of the incision tool, take care not to injure the eye by your operation.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscides aquelas o am espatum le qual nos havem recomtat en la inscizio de la ungla, o am petitas forfexs am las quals es colligit ascebel segon que vindra la forma de lu aprop aquest capitol.	And your incision should be by which you incised the nail or by spatula as we recommended in the incision of the nail, or with small forceps with which it is collected like an onion according to its form, refer to that chapter.
Donc cum es complida la tua inscizio e es remauguda tota aquela carn, lahoras omple le huel de sal trissa, o destilla en lu polvera roga e semblantz a lu de las medicinas corrossivas, e pausa sobre le huel deforo coto am album de huou entro que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	So when your incision is finished and all the flesh has been discharged, then fill the eye with ground salt or vinegar made from wine, or sprinkle in it red powder resembling that of corrosive medicines, and place over the eyeball a bandage soaked in white of egg until it is secured against an ulcerated pustule.
E si roman alcuna causa de alguardenici e es senhoragat sanc caut, e temes apostema caut, lahoras leyssa le huel e cura aquela apostema am aquo que ceda aquela apostema, e aprop itera sobre aquel am operacio entro que sia sanat, e semblantment fay en la carn ajustada la qual accideys en le huel de aquesta especia.	And if any cause of the white of the eye becomes inflamed and there is a pustule, then let the eye discharge and cure that pustule with what reduces it; then repeat your operation on it until it is healed, and similarly do in the compressed flesh which occurs in this kind of eye.
Mays empero tu cove que alienes tota curacio del huel freul per via natural o per via accidental, obran am ferr, e no metas la tua ma en alcuna de aquestas operacios entro que veges que aquel membre sia suffertant aquela operacio.	However, you should know that you prevent all cure of the eye by natural or accidental way, done with an iron, and not put your hand in any of these operations until you see that this member is suffering from that operation.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De colleccio de sabel en le huel.	Of the gathering of pus in the eye.
Sabel so venas rogas las quals son testudas sobre le huel e prohibeysso al vesement la sua operacio, e develican le huel am longitut de dias.	Red veins which are swollen over the eye and prevent its operation, and open the eye for a length of days.
Donc necessari es al comensament que tu consideres si le huel en le qual es sabel es fort e en lu no es autra malautia que sabel, lahoras tu colligeys aquel sabel.	So it is necessary at the beginning that you consider whether the eye in which there is pus is strong and there is not another illness, then collect that pus.

o so dos oncis gradantment en un cos segon aquesta forma:	or two irons sloping into one body according to this form:
E aprop sian colligidas aquelas venas am forses subtils, am subtilitat, e abstergeys le sanc hora aprop hora, entro que vegas aquelas venas esser remaugudas del huel e sian revolgudas.	And then let those veins be bound with fine cords, with thinness, and wash the blood now and then, until you see those veins become discharged from the eye and are reduced.
E guarda te que tu no ledes le huel am las extremitatz del spatum; e si’ la tua operacio en le miegjorn denant le solelh, e sias mot ferm en la tua operacio que no inscidas sino aquelas venas.	And take care not to injure the eye with the tip of the spatula; and if your operation is on the evening side in front of the sun, and keep it steady in your operation that you do not incise except those veins.
E quan tu auras complitz, lahoras tu distilla en le huel cief vert o rog per que am sa acuitat corrodesca aquo que es remaugut del sabel.	And when you have finished, then distill into the eye wine made from grape must or vinegar so that it has an astringent action on what has been discharged from the pus.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible colligeys tot en aquela hora, e lahoras tu emplastra tot am aquo que cede la dolor de lu, e leyssa lu per alcus dias entro que sia sedada la dolor de lu e que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	But if it is not possible for you to collect everything in that hour, then apply a poultice over everything which relieves the pain of it, and let it remain for several days until the pain of it is appeased and secured against an ulcerated pustule.

Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De reduccio de arizati al nas.	Of the reduction of hernia to the nose.

E donc cum es descubert le os e vezes en lu corrupcio o negror, lahoras tu ratz lu am un sturment del qual aquesta es la forma:	And when you see that the bones are exposed and blackened by corruption, then you should treat them with an instrument of this shape.

Donc si·l loc es consolidat e es en lu nascuda bona carn e es abscindit le cors de la sania e roman per xl dias, e no es renovat e no es apostemat e no accideys en lu accident, lahoras tu sapias que es sanat. Capitol .xx.	Chapter .XX.
De reduccio de la eminencia del huel.	Of the reduction of a protrusion from the nose.

Capitol .xxii.	Chapter .XXII.
De curacio de alconati.	Of the cure of alconatis.
Aquesta malautia que es apelada alconati no es sino sania la qual es ajustada en le huel semblant a aygua dessendent e no es aquela.	This illness that is called alconatis is not anything other than an ulcer which is settled in the nose like water flowing down and it is not that.

But the way of working on it is that you make the patient sit up straight and lean forward, and then take his head in your hands from two sides and move it so that you see the ulcer coming to the upper parts; then let it be dried and not flow down, and let there be light, and the patient sees the causes as he looks.
E si no descendra en jos, sapias que es aygua.	And if it does not flow down below, you should know that it is water.

Capitol .xxii.	Chapter .XXII.
De la curacio de la aygua descendent del huel.	Of the cure of water flowing from the nose.

Capitol .xxiv.	Chapter 24.
De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	Of the cure of nose pain.
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat. Then let it be known that you put oil of the dog in which there is thickness, and wet in him words of a nosebleed, and place between each nose the quantity of a finger or less, and rub the patient's face and insert one extremity of the oil into the nostrils with the ray or for any other cause which it is possible to him.

Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	But if it is difficult to cure that which has been squashed, use it.

E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	And do this with silver or gold, which is like a little open lantern, likewise with little heat, and the meat likewise.
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	And if you want to, make a closed pipe likewise with reed, and the socket of the instrument for cleansing nosebleeds is flat, uncovered; to which there is handle on it, with which you hold it in him, pouring oil or what you want from the sucks and the causes sucking.
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	And these are the ingredients for this recipe: take the fur of a beaver, white balsam, ginger, saffron, long pepper, spikenard, epithyme and rose-pinks, each in an ounce quantity. You will make an ointment from the juice of beetroot and cabbage, and these should be made into pills, and a pill should be tempered with tepid water, and it should be dropped into the nostrils of the patient who is lying down facing upwards.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	Of warts on the ends of the nose:
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	A brown spot appears on the ends of the nose, and it grows larger in a few days unless the patient is given a cure.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And because of this, you should cut off that spot at its very beginning and remove it all.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	Then place on the spot a cautery or burning medicine which will remain in place of the spot.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	But if its growth has been delayed until it becomes hard and dark-coloured, with little feeling in it, then do not touch that spot with an iron, because such spots usually cause great harm to the person on whom they are.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the spot is soft and not dark-coloured, and its growth seems possible in all, then evacuate the patient and cut that spot out without fear, and cure the wound with something that will dry it and draw it together until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	Of the stitching of the nose and the lips and the ears when their continuity is dissolved by a ulcer or a similar wound.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	Know that whenever there is an accident of discontinuity in one of these cartilage structures, there are few who perform the operation successfully.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	So, whenever for any cause, you find that there is a fresh ulcer with its blood, then bring together the two lips of the ulcer with a suture, and then cure it until it is healed.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the lips of the discontinuity of the wound are already separated and each has healed by itself, then cut off each part of the wound that is exposed until its blood issues.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then bring together the two lips with a suture and strengthen them, and over that sprinkle dragon's blood and fine-ground iron pyrites, and place on the powder some of the emollient plaster, or one of the other consolidative plasters, and let it lie for two days or three, and then take off the plaster and change the ointment, and let it lie until the scabs have fallen off by themselves, and then cure it with an ointment until it is healed.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	But the manner of the stitching is that you put together the discontinuity with needles as we have recommended in the stitching of the belly, or put together the discontinuity with pitch as we have told you and make known.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	Of the extraction of those causes that come in the two lips on the parts within.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Many people have in the inner lips of their mouths hard warts resembling the skin of a hornet, and some are small and others large.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	So cut through the lips and open up each of those hard growths all around, and then fill the opening with finely-ground sage until the blood is stopped, and then wash it with wine vinegar and cure the wound with something that constricts, until it is healed.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	Of the cutting of the meat which is attached to the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	Often there is on the gum a piece of meat attached which the ancients called albus, so you should suspend that with wax or have it held with tweezers and cut that from its root, and let the blood or sap run out.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	Then place on the spot finely-ground sage or other constrictive or astringent powders.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	And if that meat returns, then cut it again and cauterize it, for the cautery will not return.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	Of the reason of teeth with an iron.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When in the surface of the teeth on the inner and outer lips and between the gums are attached rough, sharp, black or green spots which corrupt the gum and make the teeth loose.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	So take a sharp knife and make an incision in the patient's mouth, and press on his head with your thumb, and scrape away the teeth where these rough spots appear, and remove their causes, which will resemble sand, so that no cause remains, and this will remove the blackness and the greeness and the other things until they are clean.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	So if what is in those at the beginning of the cause is good, so much the better; and if not, then do the cause again on those on another day, and on the second and on the third until it comes to the final point where you want.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And know that teeth have need of many razors of diverse forms and shapes according to your operation.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And therefore the razor with which the tooth is scraped from the inner lip is different from the razor with which it is scraped between the teeth, and these forms of razors should be prepared as follows:
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	Of the eradication of teeth.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	You should cure the tooth of its pain with every artifice and delay in complete eradication of it, for there is no cause that excuses it when it becomes visible as soon as it is eradicated, for it is a sublimated substance which causes excuse in its eradication.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	But if the patient is forced to have that tooth eradicated, you must be certain which is the painful tooth, for many times pain deceives the patient and remains while the tooth is healthy, and you eradicate it and then the pain does not cease until the painful and sick tooth has been eradicated, for we have already seen this through operation of the barbarians.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	So when you are certain which is the painful tooth, and that you know it, then cut around the circuit of the tooth with a chisel in which there is some vertidity, so that it is dissolved from the gum on all sides, and then maul it with your fingers or with fine pincers little by little until you concuss it.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	Then put in it strong tenacles with great force or grip strongly, and press the head of the patient between your teeth which do not hurt him, and then pull the tooth according to rectitude in a manner that you do not break it, nor give the patient major pain.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And if it is not loose, then take one of those instruments and put that down all around with ease and effort the removal of it in such a way as it was done at the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is cracked or hollow, then fill that crack and tighten it with a subtle wire on the end so that it does not loosen when you apply your constriction to it while you are holding it.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And you should open widely with scraping around the circuit of all parts of the gum and keep your strength so that you do not break it, and return to the patient for the malice which is greater than the first pain of him.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And beware that you do not do what some ignorant barbers do in their audacity about the eradication of them, for they do not administer what we have recommended; for many times great sicknesses come upon men which are very difficult to loosen, and their teeth are very hollow or all rotten, or they extract it with some bones from the mandible as we have often witnessed.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	Then the patient's mouth should be washed with wine vinegar or wine mixed with salt.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if blood flows from the wound, as well as several vesicles, then sprinkle some powdered vitriol over the wound and if it does not stop, cauterize.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The shape of the tweezers and thin tongs with which a tooth is extracted at the beginning should have a long shaft, a short handle, and be thick so that they do not bend when you are working with them.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And let the tweezers have such a thick shaft that when you are pulling with them they do not bend, and short shafts.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And let them be made of iron from India descending from straight shafts, and at the ends of those there are teeth which fit into each other and extract by strong compression, and sometimes the ends of those are in the shape of a stork's beak, which is hooked, and they are of strong compression.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	Of the extraction of teeth and of the dislocation of the bones of the jaw when it is broken.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you need to extract a tooth which is broken due to some cause, then you should apply a poultice over the site for one or two days until the site is softened; and then insert tweezers or tongs, the ends of which are like the beak of an owl called a stork, or hooked, in the shape of forceps:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	The ends of them are made flat like a file or an alfileter.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if it does not obey you with these forceps or tongs, then you should cut above the gum and uncover all the flesh and insert the instrument which is called a lever, a small one of which the shape is as follows:
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And let it be short and thick at one end, and not bent so that it does not break.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Therefore if through this the gum is pierced, that is good; and if not, help yourself with these other instruments of which these are the shapes: the shape of the first instrument is triangular at one end, in which there should be some thickness:
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The shape of the second instrument is that it is triangular and very thin at the end.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And you are helped with this instrument having two ramps, of which this is the shape, properly following:
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	and with other instruments which are used in the extraction of teeth; for help is done with this instrument which is like a wild ox, and this is the shape:
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	of the triangular end bent or short, which should have some thickness, and not bent so that it does not break.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And another wisdom is that the instruments for teeth are many and similar to the other instruments.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	But the wise and skilled artist in the art finds for himself materials according to what he understands from the operation and various illnesses; for there are illnesses to which the ancients did not give or assign proper instruments because of the forms of diverse species.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the bone of the jaw or of the other bones of the mouth is broken, or if it is dislocated, then let the foot be treated in its place with what is convenient for him from the instruments and forceps which we have said in the extraction of the gums of teeth; and help yourself with a gesture of which this is the shape:
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And let there be some thickness added to it little by little, and let it be pressed or held in the mouth so that it does not escape or slip until the bone of all is softened; and then restore the site with suitable medicines for it.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there is a little dislocation in the bone, then scrape away that dislocation and its darkness, and treat it until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	Of the cure of teeth which project above others.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When teeth are prominent not according to their natural form because of that shape, and especially when it happens to women, and especially to old women; therefore you should consider: if a tooth is adjacent to another tooth, and there is no possibility of lancing or lining it, then extract that tooth; but if it is not adjacent to another tooth, then you insert that tooth with this instrument of which this is the shape; and it is like the jaw of a pig, and let it be made of iron from India, of very acute form.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And let your insertion with which you insert that be in turns for the hardness of the tooth, and let it not be broken by another of the teeth.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if the prominent tooth is worn away to a file, then file that with an iron file from India of which this is the shape:
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And let all of it be of iron from India, and the edge evenly; and let it be of very fine points like a file with which needles are made, with which the tooth is filed little by little in a few days with ease, so that no other tooth is broken or chipped.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And then line it at the edge, and scrape it away with some razor.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if a tooth of which one part is broken and lacerated the tongue, then let you smooth that until the roughness of that fracture is worn away and dulled, and let it be flattened so that the tongue is not cut or the speech impaired.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	Of the restoration of worn teeth with gold or silver wire.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When it happens to the teeth before concussion and removal by percussion or by falling, and the patient cannot bear what he eats, and you have treated that with astringent medicines, and your treatment has not availed, then because they do not close up, there is wire made of gold and not of silver; for silver becomes blackened and then dislocates after some days, but gold never changes.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And let the wire be of such fineness and thickness according to the quantity which can enter between the teeth; and the shape of the restoration is that you take the wire and wrap it around the double of its width between two healthy teeth, and then that it grows with two tortuosity of the wire between two worn teeth, or if one or many, until it reaches the gum on the healthy tooth from the other broken part.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	And then tighten the wire around the part from which you begin, and strengthen your work with ease and skill so that it is not worn.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And let your tightening of the wire around which you tighten the wire, so that the teeth do not escape.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	And then insert the ends of the excess wire with tweezers or tongs, and add those in every site with a gesture, and fold them and conceal them between the healthy tooth and the worn tooth, so that it does not harm the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And then let it be as tight as possible like Roman.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	But if it is loose or jagged, tighten that or those with another wire in the same way at all times.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of teeth and the figure of the restoration of two healthy teeth and two worn teeth, as follows:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when a tooth or two return to their place after the falling of any of them in their sites, and they are restored as we have described, and they are worn again.
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	And it is not done except by wise artists.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And sometimes it happens because of some cause of the bones of a cow, and it is made like a tooth in form, and it is placed in the site where the tooth failed, and it is tightened as we have said, and it remains and serves for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter XXXIV.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	Of the beginning of the disease that affects the tongue and prohibits speech.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This condition that affects the tongue can be either innate or accidental and caused by a plague which has already become consolidated.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	The operation on the patient is to open his mouth, lift up his head and elevate his tongue, then cut that nervous ligament according to the width through which the tongue has become detached from its attachment.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	But if there is any hardness or knotting, and this is due to the consolidation of a plague, then you shall cut it with a knife and split it up to the width at which you split the ligament and the knot has been dissolved.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And take care that there is not made a fissure in the muscle of the jaw, and that you split up the artery and cause a flow of blood.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	Then the trace of the incision is to be washed with wine or vinegar, or with water, and a linen cloth is to be placed beneath the tongue; if there is any swelling which the patient has under his tongue on any night and it has not become consolidated in another way, then this should be done.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	But if blood flows, then apply powdered vitriol to the spot; but if it oozes out, then cauterize the spot with a cautery which is suitable for this purpose.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And let that be treated with the other remedies until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter XXXV.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	Of the extraction of a ranula beneath the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Sometimes beneath the tongue there occurs an abscess resembling a small onion, which prevents the tongue from performing its natural function, and it grows larger as it fills up the mouth.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	The operation is to open the patient's mouth facing towards the sun and examine the abscess.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if you see it of a dusky colour or black, hard, and the patient feels nothing when you touch it, then do not touch that because it is deadly.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it is white and moist, then put a knife in it and cut it all the way through; and if blood flows during the time of your operation, then put powdered vitriol on it so that the blood is staunched.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	Then return to your work and treat it as you would have done if there had been no bleeding; after washing it with vinegar and salt, let the wound be treated with the other treatment for this disease until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter XXXVI.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	Of the extraction of an abscess between two ears, and that which is found in the neck, and of the other abscesses.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When there is swelling in the neck, it consists of glands which are united like cotton; these become inflamed and are named two ears, and when you treat them as we have said in the previous chapter, if they are not healed, then consider whether the abscess is hard, dusky in colour, with little feeling, then do not touch it with iron.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is of a red colour and the root is thick, then do not touch it with iron because of the flow of blood; before you leave it, either you will draw it out or it will break open by itself.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is of a white colour, soft, and the root thin, then that is what should be cut.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the operation is that you should consider before your operation whether the abscess has already been cauterized to completion or has decreased by any decrease; and then cause the patient, facing towards the sun, his head in your lap, to open his mouth, and the assistant taking hold of his hands press his tongue down below with a noble instrument, of which this is the shape:
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	And it should be made of silver or brass, and be fine with a point.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	Then when you press the tongue down with that and the abscess is shown to you, and you put your instrument over it, then take a knife and stab that in the centre outward as far as you can.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Another which pierces through the tunics, and then cut that with an instrument of which this is the shape:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	It is like forceps but its ends are bent inwards so that the orifice of each is towards the other, and it is sharp and made of iron, tempered and greased.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	But if that instrument is not available to you, then cut it with a knife of which this is the shape: It should be sharp on one side but blunt on the other.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And after you have cut one vein, cut the other according to this method of cutting; and then have the patient guard his mouth with water.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if blood flows, guard it with water of a decoction of bark of pomegranate or of bay-leaf in the same way as for the causes which are constrictive so that the flow of blood is staunched; and then let that be treated in the same way as the others until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And sometimes there occur in the neck other abscesses besides those two ears, and cut them according to what you see and say about the cutting of two veins equally.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And there was once treated a woman of an abscess which was found in the neck, which abscess was dusky in colour and had little feeling; it closed the neck of her throat, and the woman breathed with difficulty and was prohibited from eating or drinking water, and she had reached death if she had lived for one day or two.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the abscess had grown so large that it had reached to her two ribs on either side.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	Then he cut it with a knife and took it out, and it came away as a great lump; then he opened the mouth of the patient, and pressed his tongue down, and then he put the knife in that abscess.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And then he cut a large piece out of it, and not much blood flowed from it.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	Then the neck of that woman was entirely closed up and she began to drink water immediately, and then he ate food; therefore he did not cease cutting that abscess many times over a long time, and afterwards another abscess occurred in place of it which he cut so that it is prolonged.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Then he bled and cauterized the neck of her, then she died on the spot; and afterwards he walked about for a long time but I did not know what God did to her.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter XXXVII.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	Of the cutting of the uvula when it is abscessed.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When mucous matter flows from the uvula and it is abscessed and long, then that is called perpendicular; and if at its base it is thick and rounded, then it is called a buba.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	But if it is cured by what we said in the previous chapter and does not comply with your treatment, and afterwards you see that the abscess cauterized has become small and thin; and if it is towards the length, and is sanguineous, of dusky colour or black, and the patient feels nothing there, then fear that you touch the patient.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you see it according to the way that I have said of its whiteness and length, then make the patient open his mouth and press his tongue down with an instrument of which we have said the shape and put a knife in the new one, and draw that towards you and cut it with one of two instruments which are bent like a pair of tongs.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And you should not cut anything except what is over the natural limit, for if you cut more, you will harm their speech.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	Then the incision, use that which we have recommended in the incision of two holes, and heal inside what is healed.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the patient was frightened by the incision, use trickery in his cauterization to reduce their fear, and the method of the cautery on him is simply a sharp instrument; then place the patient's head on your lap, and firmly press their tongue with the tool which we mentioned, then take the water which we mentioned in the chapter on cauterization, and mix it with some live charcoal, and pour it into the hollow of the instrument of which this is the shape:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Let the end of it be hollowed out like a spoon, and place the medicine inside as well as the concavity of the spoon, then place the instrument with the medicine over the wound; the patient should lie on their side so that saliva or mucous from their mouth runs down due to the intense medicine, so that none of it falls back into their throat and chokes them.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	Then hold the medicine in your hand, and squeeze it onto the uvula through a space of about half an hour until you see it become blackened and numbed by the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you wish, take a needle and wrap it in the medicine at its end, then immerse the needle in the medicine and insert the needle with the cotton into the uvula until the cotton adheres to the uvula inside; do this as many times as needed until you achieve what you want from the cauterization of the uvula, then let it be for three or four days until it dries up and falls off.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that the medicine needs to be reapplied, then do so; and after the cauterization, wipe the area around the uvula with a cotton swab dipped in a bowl of water, then cleanse it with whatever is in the bowl of water, then wash it with warm water, and dress the wound outside with ointment, and inside with unguents until it heals.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this type of treatment is more safe than incision and less frightening.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Sometimes the uvula is healed by something more subtle than cauterization or incision, for it is cured by fumigation in this manner: take calamus, hyssop, oregano, rue, Arabic thistles, chamomile, broom and similar plants to those herbs, and put all of these ingredients, or some of them, into a bowl, then immerse them in boiling wine; let the bowl be warmed with decent heat, and there should be a hole in the middle of the bowl on which to place an hollow instrument made of silver or copper.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	Then insert the end into the patient's mouth so that the steam reaches their uvula through the tube, until the uvula is very foggy.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	Then do this several times until it is dry; and beware of doing this cure at the beginning of an apoplectic fit, for it would push the apoplexy too far into the brain, and you should not do this, but wait until the apoplexy has subsided.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	But if you do not have this instrument at hand, then take a reed and fix a plug of wool at its end so that the patient's mouth is closed off; for the wool plug prevents the steam from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this treatment is beneficial to health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter XXXVIII.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	Of the extraction of thorns and of what adheres in the throat, and of other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Many times something adheres in the throat or a thorn from the foot or some other cause.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Then you must extract what is visible from it, then press the tongue with an instrument in front of your eyes, so that you see what is in the throat.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And what is hidden in the throat, you must make the patient vomit before the food becomes digested in the stomach, for the cause of the throat often resides there; or the patient should swallow a piece of napkin or a ball of lettuce or a loaf of dry bread; or they could swallow a piece of dry sea sponge, and then chew it with their teeth, then they should swallow it, for when it reaches the spot in the throat where the thorns are, they will be driven out.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	Or take an eel and chew it with their teeth, then swallow it, or take a pig's tail and chew it and spit it out.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	But if they are not driven out by those causes which we have mentioned, then use an instrument made of lead in this shape:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And it should be bigger than a small needle, and at its end there should be a hollow which you insert into the patient's throat with ease.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And let the patient hold their head up, and beware of touching their bones in the throat, so that it does not move them or touch the thorn or anything else; then let the doctor hold his hand there.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But if the patient wants to insert it themselves due to their knowledge of the location of the cause and they push it in and pull out their hand according to the amount that is prepared for them, then it will be driven out.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter XXXIX.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	Of the extraction of blood which adheres in the throat.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When the blood is stopped by what we have said in the division of treatment with medicines and does not respond, then consider the throat of the patient when you press their tongue with the instrument which we have recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Therefore if you see the blood, extract it with a small needle or a very thin and decently pointed one.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if you are unable to extract it with that, then take a hollow tube and insert it into the patient's throat; then place a hot iron in the hollow of the tube, and do this several times until the blood is dead and comes out of their throat; then the patient should abstain from all water for the whole day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	Then take a pitcher full of warm water, and pour it into their mouth, then rinse their mouth with it; do not swallow any of the water, just spit it out after an hour has passed, then hold your hand over their mouth again for another hour, for when the blood is dead, it will come out immediately.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	But if it is not driven out by what we have recommended, then smoke the patient's throat with camphor or asafoetida through the instrument which we recommended for smoking the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this until it falls.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And there is another way to smoke it: take a bowl in which there are burning coals and the bowl should be covered with a lid that has a hole in it; then place the end of the instrument in the hole, and let the smoke out through the instrument; then hold the patient's mouth over the end of the tube, and close their mouth so that the smoke does not escape until you know that the smoke has reached the blood, for the blood will fall immediately.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not work, then do the smoking many times; and let the patient abstain from drinking, and eat salt causes and eggs, and drink no water; and by this regimen it will be driven out.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	This is the shape of the instrument with which blood is drawn from the vein when it is seen; and it is similar to forceps except that there is some curvature in it.
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is placed on the vein, and its end is similar to a stork's beak, which is gloved, in which it is tightened with a file, so that when we press for any reason, it does not slip.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the sum of the speech in the opening of abscesses and their section.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Abscesses are of many kinds, according to what is remembered about them, of each one in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are diverse in their puncturing and sectioning in two ways, of which one is by the species of abscesses themselves; and because we compress them by the moisture.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second way is by the places in which they occur in the body, for the abscess that occurs in the head is different from that in the buttocks; and the abscess in the fleshy part is different from that in the joint; and each of them is treated by operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And some abscesses there are which must not be punctured but rather matured in the pus in them, or completed.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	And other abscesses there are which must not be punctured when they are tough, and not matured according to their complement, as well as abscesses which are near the joints; for an abscess which comes near a joint prolongs its being in that it affects the ligaments or nerves of that joint, through which there is contraction of that member; or it is an abscess near a principal member, and if you delay its puncturing when it is mature it will harm the principal member; or it is near the buttocks, and one must not let it mature, but rather to puncture it, so that the pressure on it may not be prolonged and it elongated to the parts within the buttocks, and a fistula made, or that it be done in its term so that it will not be healed.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	But you must know the hour of the puncturing of the abscess, and that is when it is mature.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And you should know that it is mature when there is the ceasing of the pain and the fever, and moreover the lessening of the heat and the pulse, and the acute feeling of the head of the abscess, and the other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And because you should know the puncturing to occur in the place where there is pus below the abscess, and also pus coming from the healing of the eminence.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And the puncturing is always through the length of the flesh or body if the abscesses are in the parts of the hands or feet, and in the place of the tendons, of the cords of the nerves, of the grooves; and, at last, in all places alike in which there is no reflection; for in those where it is reflected, use puncturing according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the abscess is in a fleshy place, it is better to let its puncturing be so that its digestion is confirmed according to its complement, as we have said; for if you puncture it before that, the course of the pus of it is prolonged and much filthiness comes from it, and moreover its lips are hardened and its depth.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some abscesses are punctured according to the latitude of the flesh or body by reason of necessity, or according to that by which the member needs.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And you should administer a small puncturing in small abscesses, and in large abscesses great puncturing and ample or many sections according to the diversity of the sizes of the abscesses.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And some are of abscesses in which the vein is hollowed out and cut into, when it is made thus so that bread and made is in term that it already is, as well as that which occurs in trops of dubelec and of buboes.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of those some are that are cut into with three angles; and of those is the one in which it is cut as the shape of a leaf of mirtle, as well as the abscesses of the angle-makers.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And of those some are in which round section and lunar section is administered, and like those.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But that to which there is not head as with its abscesses superficial, you should puncture it with superficial puncturing, or plane only.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the abscess is large and has collected much pus, you should puncture it and not be afraid to draw out all the pus in that hour; having drawn from it a part, then plug up the abscess for another day, and moreover draw a larger part, and do this many times according to degree until it is hole-gutted.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is of cold nature, or woman in labour, or small child, or old person in decrepitude, for the animal spirit many times is resolved by the egress of pus, and very often the patient dies, and you operate on them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Therefore keep this chapter with great caution, and moreover your puncturing in which you puncture these abscesses, you should wash the plagues and consider then if the plague of the abscess is little, or a flat section, then you administer lambs' wool or old linen; and if the abscess is large, and the fissures of the puncturing are many, then you must pause a moment in each piercing until they come out.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the abscess a part of the vein is cut into or hollowed out in its circuit, then you must complete it with old linen or thread made from cloth of lamb's wool, as well as when you have drawn pans or roots, without moisture; and plug up that for the third day; and moreover process it and heal it by what means of enguentz within that it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.
