Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	But if the blood is not stopped, and you see that you must apply medicine to it, then you should incise the artery, if it appears to you; for the extremity of it is constricted, and the blood is stopped; or take a piece of cotton, and cover that, and take half of it and tighten that over the location of the vein with a bandage, descending with a ligature on another day.
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	And then if the blood is stopped, that is good; and if not, then heal that with what it was preceded from the location of the powders causing stopped blood flow.
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	And the stopping of the blood in some dispositions is difficult due to the small location of the wound and the possibility of constriction of the arm.
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	But from the dark vein, phlebotomy is beneficial when you extract blood from the upper part of the head and from the lower part of the body; because of this it is composed of a branch of the basilic and of a branch of the cephalic, as we have said.
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	And it is appropriate for the phlebotomist to be very cautious in the phlebotomy of that, because beneath it there is a nerve; and so if he err and puncture the phlebotomy needle into the nerve and injure the nerve, stupor will occur, and healing from it will be difficult, and some people will not heal at all. And this nerve sometimes appears to some men and is subtle and not obvious, then you should place the phlebotomy with which you phlebotomize with a section of alnessil, and avoid the nerve with your strength.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	And if the vein is between two nerves, then cut the vein in length.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The benefit of phlebotomy of the cephalic vein is that it draws blood from the head and benefits illnesses of the eyes.
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	And it is appropriate in this particularly that you should phlebotomize with a phlebotomy needle made of olive or of myrrh; for it is the safest of all veins, because beneath it there are no arteries nor nerves.
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	But however, it is appropriate for you that in phlebotomy, you should be careful that with the phlebotomy needle, you do not puncture only the head of the wrist and seek the location farthest away, and do not notice it if it is not struck by the first percussion to be over it by phlebotomy several times.
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	But however, in some people, it is only apostemat when it is not phlebotomized in the first percussion, but do not notice that apostema.
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	But the quality of that and its accidents are many, in which you should consider their correction.
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	The first of these is that one should know that phlebotomy is not administered except in preservation of health and for hope of it, and that phlebotomy be done at the beginning of spring, over breakfast in spring and autumn, and in winter, when there are signs of engorgement.
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	And phlebotomy be done and on the third day, or the first after that three hours have passed.
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	But phlebotomy which is administered, but when it provokes convenience and necessity for that, or at night or during the day, at any time and at any moment.
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	And a child should not be phlebotomized until he is fourteen years old, and a pregnant woman should not be phlebotomized except from the fourth month until the seventh, and the elderly should not be phlebotomized who have already passed sixty years.
E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.	And when someone wants to be phlebotomized for any reason, it is appropriate that he cleanse his intestines before phlebotomy with a lion's claw, if in them there are motes of retained fends, so that the veins do not cast off the superfluities in the phlebotomy of the intestines, which are purified, and that they do not harm the principal members.
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	And let not be phlebotomized the patients with recent fever and vomiting, or recovering from illness, nor due to drunkenness, nor because of the cause that dissolves virtue, whether in body or soul. And let phlebotomy be avoided during colic pain and after vomiting, and after abdominal discomfort, and during multiplication of urine and defecation, and from every cause that dissolves virtue.
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	And consider in the subtlety of humors before that if the blood is thick with foods and drinks, and with medicines if it is possible for it.
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	And enter into a bath if any cause does not prohibit it, or it is exercised by some exercise so that the blood is purified.
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	And do the phlebotomy of him in the feet in the middle of the day, so it is around the hour of terce, as we have said.
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.	And be careful that the feet of him are guarded in that day from all evil accidents, as it is anguish, anger, fear, and from all bodily accidents, as it is labour and excessive pain and voiding and شبیه to them.
E a la sua sezelha fassa esser presentz las causas en le us de la qual corr costuma dels homes am aromaticitat e odorament e am bals e semblantz ad aquels segon la cantitat de possibilitat.	And in its use, let the causes be present in the use of which the blood is used for men with aromatization and odour and with balsams and شبیه to them according to the quantity of possibility.
E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	And let the phlebotomist follow over a joint that is above that the joint which must be phlebotomized.
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	And then extend his arm, and rub that by the phlebotomist two or three times; and then tighten the ligature with a bandage and wrap that two times.
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	And let the constriction be moderate, because if the constriction is not equal or the constriction is with superfluity, then blood flow is prohibited; or it is with softening, and then blood flow of the body is prohibited.
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	And then the constriction, so that the person who is to be bled, rubs his hands together between them until the veins are swollen and become apparent to the sense.
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	And then the phlebотомist anoints his phlebotomy knife with a little of the proper old oil; and then he places his left hand's index finger over that vein, below the site from which he wishes to perform the phlebotomy, so that the vein escapes a little, and the pulse is slowed down because some veins are compressed like cords when they flee, and from those is extracted the ventosity, and when you place the phlebotomy knife upon it, it is contracted by the phlebotomy knife, and the phlebotomist is discovered; and the phlebotomy knife does not open the vein, and if it opens it, that vein is constricted.
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	And thus, so that the phlebotomist is stopped up and is solicited in all these causes.
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	And then you put down the phlebotomy knife, but if the vein is open in a bend, then it is good; and if not, you iterate that or another bend below that location a little, or on it with a festival, if the location is not pustular.
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	And if the location is pustular, or the patient becomes frightened, then you let it be for one or two days, and do not strain the limb, because soon it will throw off the pustule through cautery, nor enter into a bath.
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	And then iterate the phlebotomy if it is desired.
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	And if the wound is small and subtle blood seeps out, and you fear that not enough blood will come out the desired amount, then you iterate the phlebotomy in that cut according to rectitude and adjust in the wound a little, and do that with festival in front of what the location is pustular, because the location is pustular in most men due to small wounds.
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	But if you see that one already pustular, then do not iterate on it, because it does not excuse you for any cause; and put over that some part of the cut with oil, because it expels the body of blood.
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	And it is better in this location than other oils.
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	And similarly administer cut of oil in every phlebotomy with which phlebotomists phlebotomize the veins according to the prohibition of body of blood, and they do that tyriaca alfadoc and sagzenea when it is put from one of those on the location, because the blood is subtilized and is revolved when it is thick.
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	And if in the location of the phlebotomy a great pustule is engendered, because many bends happen, and mainly to that which is not bled but that bend, or in the wound of the vein little, then you cut it, and put on the location sponge infused in water and salt, a little warmed, and constrict that for one hour, because it is dissolved.
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	And so that he does that appropriately the movement of blood from that vein with fulfillment of him or another vein.
E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.	And if it turns in the location for several days any blackness or greenness, do not note that; and if you want to, put over that some cause of aloe and myrrh dissolved, or some cause of juice of gentian or of camomile or similar to him.
E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	And many times happen pustules and eminences due to phlebotomy of the basilic.
E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.	And then put your hand over that, and if you then press upon that with your hand strongly, then that eminence is wicked and bad; and then beware that you put on that any cause of what we have said, because soon blood will flow from the artery.
E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And make a poultice with what is astringent, so that the location is hardened, and then cure that with the other cure until it is healed.
E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.	And so that you extract blood from every man according to the quantity of his virtue and according to the color winning over the blood according to what appears.
Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.	Because if the blood is black, then you let it go until it becomes red; and similarly if you see it thick, then you let it go until it becomes subtilized; and similarly if it is acute, until the acuteness of it is lost.
E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat. E en aquel que es freul, sia fayt le contrari de aquel, e cove que extragua aquel en tropas veguadas, e que le trauc sia streyt.	And in him who is feeble, let the contrary of that be done, and so for him who extracts that in many bends, let the cut be narrow.
E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	And what is best administered in phlebotomy of vein is that it is the transverse section, not puncture.
E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.	And this manner of phlebotomy is safe from flow of blood and incision of nerve, and it is more pleasantable and safer than phlebotomy according to width and length.
E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre. E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	And use the other causes which we have said in the division in the chapter of syncope for evacuation.

Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	But who wants to throw the blood of his body contrary to the side to which he inclines, let that be opened on the second or third day.
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent. E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal. E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas. E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	And the quality of the phlebotomy is that the patient puts his hand in warm water so that the vein swells up and the vein appears clearly.
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut. E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	And the incision should be wide and your phlebotomy should be with which you bleed that on the joint of the hand a little.
E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat.	And if the flow of blood is prohibited, then you put the hand again in warm water and let the blood run in the water until you achieve your need.
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	But if you are in the summer days, then you are excused from putting the hand in warm water, and the month is put the body of blood in cold water in winter time.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And phlebotomy of this vein is safer than all other veins because from here there is no pulsating vein or nerve.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And phlebotomy of the wrist of the right hand is related to diseases of the liver.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	And the quality of phlebotomy is that you bind the hand with a ligature or your hand, since you have put it in warm water so that the vein is swollen and is clearly demonstrated by looking at it; and phlebotomy the transverse vein; and if you pierce it from any side it will not harm.
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	And beware that you do not pierce your hand with the phlebotomy, because here are the nerves of the teeth which are bare of flesh.
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	And then put the hand again in warm water and let the blood run in that, for if you do not put it in warm water, the blood will coagulate in the opening of the vein, and it is prohibited to flow.
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	And when blood is extracted according to the quantity of necessity, then you put oil and salt on the vein so that it is not consolidated by clotting; and similarly you do in all wound.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	But the benefit of phlebotomy of that of the left hand is related to diseases of the brain.
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	And do similarly in the phlebotomy of him as you have done in the other.
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	And the benefit of phlebotomy of the vein is to diseases that are below the body, as well as diseases of the mother, and retention of menses, and diseases of the lungs and ulcers of thighs and legs, and their like of the diseases.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	And the quality of phlebotomy is that the patient puts his foot in warm water and makes friction on it so that the veins appear clearly; and bind over the joint of the foot with a bandage; and the location of the vein is found between the toes, and from there it is branched into the fascia of the foot many small branches.
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	And therefore phlebotomy the widest branch or below the leg where it comes from the talus bone because it is better and safer.
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	And if you phlebotomize that in the fascia of the foot, then you must beware of nerves which are below that on the fascia of the foot, and place your phlebotomy with which you phlebotomize across, as if you wanted to pierce it.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And let the phlebotomies be gentle.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	But if it is prohibited to raise the blood, then you put the foot of him in warm water and let the blood run in that so that it is evacuated.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the phlebotomist mistakes in the first time, then you repeat with phlebotomy on his few times, for the location is safer; and do not fear of evil, but beware of nerves as we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And similarly do with the other foot equally.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And of the sciatic nerve, its location as we have said is below the talus bone from the wild heel.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the benefit of phlebotomy of it is to hip pain when it is due to blood heat.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	And the quality of phlebotomy is that the patient bathes and ties a bandage tightly around his thigh from behind below the hip over the top of four fingers in one long band, for it appears only by this.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And therefore when it appears, then you phlebotomize that according to any angle that is possible to you and according to the transverse vein, and it is better; or pierce that by incision or secces that vein by section, for its location is safer.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And it is in most men hidden; and if you pierce that, and it does not appear at all, then phlebotomy some branch of it, and it is the one which appears on the back of the foot opposite the little finger and ring finger.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And beware of nerves, and let the blood run in the quantity that you want.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	And then loosen the bandage and place it over the location of phlebotomy tightly, for loosely it is not healthy.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of ventilation and the qualities of using those.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Ventozes are of horns, or of ram, or of glass.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And ventilation is done according to two ways: the one is by scarification and extraction of blood, and the other is ventilation without scarification.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this ventilation which is without scarification is according to two ways, for it is with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And the ventilations which are administered by scarification and extraction of blood are twelve locations of the body, of which one in which they pause ventilations is the alnocrati, and it is the back part of the head; and the middle location of them from two parts of the neck together; and ventilations of the chin below the mandible more below the mouth; and ventilations of two spatulas; and ventilations of alohoster, and it is on the edge of the throat; and ventilations of two focils, and they are of two arms; and ventilations of two cavilhas; and ventilations of two thighs.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And ventilation does not extract blood but from the small scattered veins in the flesh, and for that it does not have the virtue through them, as well as through phlebotomy; nor beware that ventilation is done with fire or without fire in any disease made by repletion so that the whole body is evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	But if necessity prompts ventilation for disease or continence, administer that at the beginning of the month and in the end of it, and in the middle of it and whenever time is.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The reason for which it is in men in which blood is multiplied while indigestion of extraction by ventilation and atrobation in his head heaviness and dryness; and of those who atrobate repletion and rigidity on their face, and on their neck; and of those who atrobate pricking in the face, or that the tongue is swollen and spews blood; and of those whose sleep is multiplied, and of those who bleed in sleep awaking and old and phlegmy and other causes to them similarly.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And therefore when you see any of these signs, and especially if they occur in the third or fourth week of the month, then we command that a purgative be administered after two or three hours have passed during the day.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And the purpose of purging from the neck is that when there is pressure in the head and this is accompanied by a swelling in the throat, then it is appropriate for there to be an evacuation of the whole body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this purging is in the place of phlebotomy on the cephalic vein.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	And it is not advisable to use one who has a complexional tendency to phlegm, or in whom there is a cold, for this causes great harm.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And because of this, one should not use those who are old and whose heads have cold diseases.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	But if someone is being treated with this method and they show signs of fainting, then one should command the person doing the purging to lift their hand slightly from the affected area in order to prevent the patient from losing consciousness.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	But the purging of the neck vein is in place of phlebotomy on the external carotid artery and the basilic vein: and because of this it helps against asthma, and the constriction of the larynx and the division of the instrument of voice, and coughing, and regurgitation.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And it is advisable to keep the neck purging light, because if it is too strong, it causes weakness in the body and in the stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And the purging of the temples helps against sudden pains in the head and against ophthalmia, and migraine, and pre-eye pain, and pains in the roots of the teeth; and it is in place of phlebotomy on the basilic vein.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And one should command the purging practitioner to not press their hand after scarification so that they do not cut into an artery and cause a flow of blood.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And purging below the chin helps against ulcers in the mouth, and corruption of the gums, and similar diseases that are in the mouth; it stands in place of phlebotomy on the alar artery which is on both lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	But the purging that is done on the two spatulas helps against headache, which is caused by regurgitation of heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And the purging of the two parts inside the corners of the eyes helps in the same way as phlebotomy on three veins: namely, the basilic, external carotid and cephalic; because that attracts blood from all those small veins which are in the skin, and those small veins between the larger veins through which the attraction comes to the three veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And command the purging practitioner not to go too deep in scarification, because the place is denuded of skin and under it there are nerves and arteries.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And it is a purging with which one purges the anus, and it helps against hemorrhoids in the rear end and ulcers that are lower down.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And one should command the purging practitioner to use a strong purging, and that it is of a ram's horn, because the place needs a strong cutting; and they should also cut it with scarification.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	But the purging of the legs should be decreased if there is a visible decrease, because it draws blood from all the body, and it helps against old pains in the knees and hips, and in the mother, and in the bladder; and it provokes menstruation, and it helps with cough and phlegm; and it stands in place of phlebotomy on two saphenous veins, and on the saphenous vein, and on two small veins.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However, they weaken the whole body and cause fainting in many people.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And the benefit of purging on the saphenous vein is similar to the benefit of purging on both legs.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	And the quality of the position of the purging is that one should pause the purging at the beginning and suck gently, and not prolong the position of the purging, but pause them briefly, and let the humors come to the place by equal attraction.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not cease repeating this and continue until I see the place already red and swollen, and the blood appearing.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And then you can scarify and repeat the suction a little at a time, and then consider the disposition of the body.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	Because if the person has soft skin on their buttocks, one should not scarify it again and again so that the place does not become ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And command the purging practitioner to enlarge the scarification and take a little more, and to temper the suction with ease.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if the blood is thick, then one should scarify two times, because in the first scarification the way of subtlety to the blood and its liquidity are opened.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	But in the second, one acquires the perspiration of the extraction of the thick blood.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is very foul, then a third scarification should be done so that one achieves the last result.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	And lastly, when we want to extract blood little by little or a little, it is enough for us to make one scarification.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want to extract a lot of blood, then we should scarify with many scarifications; and if we know that the blood is thick, then we should scarify with profound scarification.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the term of scarification in which the depth of the cut is merely superficial.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if the one from whom the cut is deep, tough, and dark, and whose veins are narrow, then the places of the purging should be anointed gently, open widely; in summer time, use oil of aloes or oil of violets, or oil of bitter almonds, or oil of cedar wood; and if it is in winter time, use oil of nard, or oil of lily, or oil of camomile, or blood, and to those similar things.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the superficiality is thick and hot, then the oil should be of myrrh, or oil of balsamite, or oil of aloes, or oil of anise, and to those similar things.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	But if the purging practitioner has ample experience of tender skin, then oil should be prohibited from them; and to those for whom the places of purging are near, the purging should be washed with water or hot water of solanum, or water of cedar wood, or water of borage, or similar things.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And if the blood is of great humidity, wash their purgings with sour wine, or water of myrtle and sumach, or similar things to those.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And if the superficialities are thick, wash their purgings with old wine, or water of mace which is myrrh, or of fennel, or of camomile, and to those similar things.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And one should keep the purging in a bath; let them have a bath, and let it be administered near the bath for an hour or two, and let him sleep after the purging.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is necessary that he should be bled before purging.
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	And let them consider at the beginning: if the purging practitioner or he who is to bleed is choleric and his blood hot and inflammation, then one should take cold remedies, also with milky parsnip, and endive in sour wine, and lettuce, and celery, and dry sage, and to those similar things.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And give them food like this with puddings, and meat of young birds, and seasoned foods with vinegar, and to those similar things.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And for those whose complexion is hot and moist, let them drink aniseed syrup, or hempseed syrup, and sumac, and wine with a strong scent between old and new; and let him be recommended to drink little and eat little, and give him dishes of partridge and hempseed and pigeons and small birds.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And for those suffering from windiness or bleeding, let them drink more than they eat during the day.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And for those who are given to drinking at certain times of the day to some men tarragon or myrrh, or medicinal musk, so that it is musky, or alcelita before windiness or bleeding, or afterwards, in order that the principal members be comforted and that the blood be subtleized; and let no one take that wound.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	But the windings that are made without scarification are windings that are paused over the liver, and over the melsa and podagra, and over the navel, in the places of the kidneys, and the pygidium of the broad, since these members do not undergo scarification upon themselves.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not desired by them but attraction of blood from the member, just as they pause a ventosa over the breast in the malady of a flow of blood from the blood of the nose; and they use that so that a moist winding may be dissolved, invaded the member, just as they pause over the belly and navel; for that rarefies the member and cuts it and removes the pain since it resolves windiness.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And it is already paused over the armpits when they occur in their swelling or poultice, for by the strength of attraction, their swelling is very much reduced and the poultice eradicates the pain from its place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And similarly it does when it is paused over the liver and the melsa due to windiness in those who are incarcerated.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these windings are administered either with sucking or merely with fire; and sometimes they are administered with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And sometimes they are administered full of tepid water in the maladies of the melsa.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And for this reason, the ventosa is filled and a pus-like substance is pushed out, either with water alone or water in which herbs appropriate to that are cut.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of ventosa administered with fire: let the width of the orifice be two digits, according to how we have formed it; and let the quantity of the fire be the size of a palm; and let it be in its side, in the place that is in its circuit, the size of it, the hole be small according to the quantity that enters into it an awl.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	Let it be made of red copper or citrine, of thick edges, lion, handles and thorns so that it does not hurt the member due to its position over it.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And let there be at its middle a transverse groove of copper or iron, where the candle with fire is paused.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And let this ventosa be somewhat larger than that which we have recommended; and the small one less than that according to the maladies and the condition of him who uses it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the windings for children and emaciated people are different from those for young people and people with large bodies.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the quality of pausing this ventosa with fire over the member is that it extends the wick with fire from decent wood in front of a few candles of wax, and pauses that over the middle of the transverse groove in the middle place of the ventosa, so that the fire be kindled around the part below so that the patient's body is not burned.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then let it be paused over the patient's member, and the finger be over the hole that we have said, until when we hold the windings and do not feel the finger and the steam rises over that hole, then the ventosa will dissolve at once.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And blow the wick according to its manner, and repeat that if you feel the need for it.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	But in the ventosa that is administered in the malady of pleurisy, with water, in which there is not a transverse groove or hole, and it is not administered except that it be filled with water, and is paused over the member merely.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is its form: And this ventosa, the larger it is, the better, so that it may receive a great quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter .xcvii.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Leeches are not administered in small members except in those in which it is not possible to place windings because of their smallness, just as with the toe and gum and their likes; or in a member stripped of flesh, just as with the finger and nose and their likes.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those leeches that if you have found in the doubled waters of boiling clean.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And then let them be placed in tepid water until they become swollen, and that no cause remains in their belly; and then let the body be evacuated at the beginning with bleeding and with windings; and then let the member of the patient be rubbed so that it becomes red; and then let them be paused over him.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are filled and swollen,
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	and if it is possible to suck the place with a ventosa, it is better to do so in bleeding.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the place with sharp wine and then with warm water; and let it be rubbed and pressed.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the flow of blood is prolonged due to the use of leeches and that drips, then you dip a cloth in tepid water and pause it over so that the dripping is absorbed.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the blood is profuse, then powder vinegar mixed with it, or gall nuts and their likes of the causes styptic, so that the blood is stopped; or let the pods of roasted peas be applied to it, and let them be paused over him until the peas adhere to the place, and let the blood stop.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And if it is necessary, let there be repetition of leeches, when it is possible to change them.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the leeches are prohibited from suspension, then let the place be rubbed with fresh blood or a needle be stuck in the places where blood flows; and then let them be paused over him, for those when I sense some blood at once.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to stop, powder over them a little aloe mixed, or salt, or ash, and tie at once.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the protection of the third part: the restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is very necessary in the art of medicine; and it is restoration of fracture and of accidental dislocation in the bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh son, you will know from this chapter the foolish doctors and the vulgarians and those who do not guard the books of the Ancients nor read from them a letter.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason, the manner of those wise in our land is private; and I have not practiced it at any time, nor have I been obliged to do so; and I have not used what I learned, except through length of reading the books of the Ancients and study on the understanding of those, so that I extracted science from them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And then add to experience and study in the length of my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described in this chapter everything that contains my science and about which my experience has passed; for I have shortened it in the end of shortening; and demonstrated it in the end of demonstration; and formed in it many forms of instruments that are administered in it, as it is done by addition of demonstration, just as I have done in two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	First chapter.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	A summary of the nature of broken bones, from which a knowledge is necessary before we begin to discuss in detail the healing of various bones and parts.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Now let us present at the beginning of this chapter, summaries of the subject that the reader must know and understand before we begin; and these chapters are for those artisans who have already achieved mastery and understanding of the truth about these matters, and also for you and others who will learn or perfect this noble art.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And so I say that when there is a fracture or dislocation or twisting or displacement, you should first apply leeches or other remedies to the affected area, or some other treatment, if no counterindications are present; also according to the strength of the patient, whether it be an adult or a child, and also taking into account any other conditions such as being in a state of weakness, or the age of the patient, or the season of violent heat, or violent rubbing.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And you should also be careful with food: eat fresh herbs and the flesh of birds and crabs; avoid fatty meats and rich foods that fill the veins with blood, unless you are sure there is no risk of pus forming in the affected limb.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to their normal routine, and correct any deviation from it that may have occurred.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And so when the broken bone begins to heal, then you should feed the patient nutritious foods that are rich and heavy, and contain a lot of moisture; such as dishes made from wheat cooked in water, rice, peas, beans, and the bellies of cows, and pigs, and fresh fish, and fatty wine and similar beverages, and with this regimen the fracture will heal sooner and better.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And you should know that the bones of old people and children are not able to knit together and heal properly because of their dry nature.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are knit together and healed according to their nature by the drying of those members; and they are knit together and healed in this way at the end of the period of softness, just as with the bones of young children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	But nature adjusts and unifies the broken bone from all sides by a kind of bonding process, by which it becomes larger and stronger, until it reaches its final state of strength and firmness, just like fire at the beginning, unless some counterindication forbids this; and no cause can prevent this from happening.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason it is necessary to feed the patient foods that are heavy and rich in moisture and substance; as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	There are different kinds of fractures, depending on the kind of bone affected.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And you should know that the kinds of fractures vary according to the different bones affected: a fracture of the bone in the leg is different from a fracture of the bone in the head, and a fracture of the bone in the foot is different from a fracture of the bone in the hand; and likewise all other bones are diverse among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And now we will discuss each kind of fracture separately, in its own chapter.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	There are different kinds of fractures, depending on the cause.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the kinds of fractures that occur in bones are diverse according to their cause: some fractures are arched and others occur as stars; and some fractures depend on the length of the bone, such as fractures of the ulna and radius, and also there are fractures of the carpal bones, and also there are disruptions and fissures.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And each kind has its own special pain or discomfort during healing, according to the location of the fracture; and we will discuss these separately in their respective locations.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	There are certain signs that indicate a bone fracture.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And by these signs you can recognize a bone fracture: it is crooked and prominent; there is pain on pressure, and also when you press with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore if there is no crookedness apparent in the bone, and the patient does not experience great pain when you press on it with your hand, then this is not a fracture.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	There is a possibility that it is only a minor crack, and so you should not press on it with your hand, but rather apply medicines to the area; then wrap the area tightly with a bandage.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And you should know that when the bone is arched and not split in two or any other way that causes a break in the skin, then you may begin to treat it immediately with an cauterization of the wound; then wrap the area tightly with a bandage.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if pus has accumulated in the wound, then let it drain for several days until the pus stops; and then treat it according to the nature of the wound and its pain.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And you should know that healing and hardening of the bone is a slower process than when it occurs in other bones.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And then strengthen it according to what we will discuss below.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if the bone is split in two parts at the joint of the leg or hand, then it is necessary to extend that affected limb in two parts, with the help of the hand or foot, or with just one hand, or with a cord and the hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And hold the limb in its natural position, while you extend the two parts of the broken bone outward; then you will have to pull them back together as strongly as possible, and according to any method that can be used on these joints.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And be careful that your movements do not cause any pain or injury to the patient during this operation, and apply as much strength as you can, while holding one bone against the other in their normal position.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And you should apply as much force as possible with your hand while holding the bone, and if you find some other cause, then straighten it out and harden it according to the amount of strength that you have.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And avoid violent extension and compression, as this can cause pus to form in the wound due to their operation, or it can also cause contraction of the limb, as we have seen happen many times due to their operations.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And then you should use splints, or an apparatus and proper operation, and a tight bandage on that limb; and rest and tranquillity; warn the patient not to move during his vigils and while sleeping, and observe his revolution and movement, and attend to his excretion, and control all his movements with as much strength as you can; and be careful that the position of the limb is one that does not cause pain, for this is the cause when there is discomfort in the disposition of the limb; then change it to another position without pain; and be careful that the bone is straight and hardened, so that the limb is not crooked when it heals.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the degree of tightness of the bandage should be one that you can tolerate; for you should know that broken bones vary in their size and shape.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And for those that are small like the arm, hand and fingers, then a fine piece of linen is used to wrap them.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	But those that are large like the thigh or leg, then a hard bandage is used to wrap them; for a tight bandage connects the large bone and strengthens it all around evenly, so that no swelling can enter.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And then you should begin by loosening the apparatus, stopping it from time to time in that place, over the fracture with three or four bandages according to the size of the bone; and strengthen your hand a little with the bandage.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then bring him to the most superior part of the area of the fracture, and with great care so that you do not break your grip on the area of the fracture.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	Then lengthen and loosen the bandage around the area of the fracture a little, and ease the tightness little by little while you take hold of a large part of the area.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	Then take another bandage and wind it around the other side of the fractured area, and then bring the bandages to the lowest part of the fracture; and your operation on the tightness of the bandage and its loosening should be according to what we have said about the first bandage above.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	Then place between the bandages of wool or cloth with which the crookedness of the fracture is equalized if there is crookedness in it; and if not, then do not put anything at all in it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	Then place another bandage over it and tie those decently made layers together at once, if there is no inflammation or abscess in the area, and then place on it something that stops the abscess and reduces the inflammation; and leave it for several days, and then tighten the layers.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And the splints should be of the thickness of a straw or reed, and they should be cleverly formed; or they could be of wood or palm branches; and the length of each splint should be according to this form and figure:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, the splint that is placed on the fracture should be thicker and longer than the other splints, and the length of the splint according to how long the limb is in size and shortness; and then tighten the splints with another bandage according to your first tightness; and then tie it above decently according to what we have said about tightness, and let your tightness be according to the location of the fracture more, and as much more as it is lengthened from the fracture, so much the lessness of the tightness.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And let the threads be moderate in thickness and thinness, and they should be of linen; and if the threads are thick, then as I have seen through the operation of some foolish people tying their threads with rope and it is a great error when the tightness is not equal.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And very thin threads are not convenient, because you will not achieve with them through tightness what you want, and let there be between each splint no less than a finger's width.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is hurt by the ends of the splints when they are tightened in their places, then place below them wool or dyed wool so that it does not harm him.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Sometimes a fracture is with pus, and there is disruption in the tendon, and I have come to remember that one in the chapter according to its uniqueness.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And know that every broken member is not bound with splints on the first day; the cause of which is because the member, when it is large, let there not be placed on it splints except after several days or a week or more, according to your certainty about the occurrence of an abscess.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the manner of the plasters with which the Ancients restored, and they were placed on fractures and dislocations and twistings.
