Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Method of plaster as a remedy for fracture, convenient to many complexities and especially to women and children, because it is that with which heat nor friction comes: and take from the powder of milling, and it is the core of the flour that passes due to the movement of the mill on the walls of the mill.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And sift that as it is, unless you sieved it with white of egg, and use the composition of it not thick nor thin; and then use it.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another manner of healing broken and dislocated bones: take of assafetida, laudanum, acacia, enula, and myrrh, the juice of wild mastic tree, all in equal parts, a drachma each; of myrrh and aloe, a drachma each; of honey, twenty drachmas; mix them all together and add enough alum wine to make an ointment, and spread it on the affected part. This preparation is of good composition, and restores quickly broken bones, and confers health to many men.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another manner of an ointment that heals broken bones and dislocations: take mastic and white myrrh, a drachma each; myrrh and aloe, a drachma each; acacia, six drachmas; Armenian bole, twenty drachmas.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	All are strained in a mortar with mortar, and sifted, and mixed with vinegar or white of egg, and let it be administered.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Method of plaster for joints and bones separated from their places, and to alleviate pain accidentally in those and to fissures and fractures: take a piece of flannel which is wet with warm wine and oil and let it be placed over the area.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	Let this plaster not be efficacious for restoration, nor for abscess, but rather to expel pains properly.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another method of plaster which restores a broken bone: take bark of fig tree and bark of wild poppy; crush both and make plaster from them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida .i.; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	Method of plaster abridged administered for the restoration of a fracture of bone and when you want resolution of the residue of an abscess: take ground of poplar, of camomile and flowers of violets, of flour of oats, of all an equal part .x.; and let all be strained and mixed with wine if the member is not scalded.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	But if it is scalded, then let that be moistened with water of yarrow or with water and use it.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another method of plaster stronger in resolution when that first one does not occur, when there is an abscess hard due to the restoration of the member: take ground of poplar and of seed of linseed and of balaustine, and marjoram, violets, camomile, of all an equal part; let all be strained and mixed with water of yarrow or with water, all according to the quality of the member and the rest of its color.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	And let the hypocrass not be applied on its own but let it be placed over the broken member due to its restoration unless a poultice is made of wax and oil, and nothing else, and let it be moderate between thickness and thinness.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	May the healing of the broken limb be accomplished by placing on it those remedies that cause moisture, heat and a quality like myrrh, incense and similar substances to those we have mentioned.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	A way to make a plaster that will benefit a wound and pain: take honey, eggs, human hair or bird feathers, alder bark and salt, all ground together; strain them through a cloth and make a plaster from it.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	But the amount of time that the binding should be left on depends on how well the healing is going and whether there is any pain or swelling or if the bone is broken or dislocated; if there is no pain or swelling and the bone is not dislocated, then you can leave it in place for a few days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if there is severe pain or swelling or inflammation in the area, then you should either cut it off or take off the plaster.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	And take a piece of linen and a sponge soaked in sea-lion oil, and dip that in lukewarm water and use it to wash the area until the swelling goes down and the pain is relieved; then let the limb rest for an hour; and apply lanolin mixed with sweet wine or rose oil, and leave it on overnight so that any pus from an abscess can come out and so that the swelling of the limb will go down and the pain will be relieved.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat this subtle binding and plaster, and don't tighten it too much with your first binding, but apply it sutilly so that the limb can heal.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if the abscess and heat and pain and swelling and all the other signs have gone down completely, and you have removed the plaster and binding, then you should repeat the process as you did at the beginning.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o .vii.; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if none of those causes we have mentioned occur in the limb, then don't take it off but rather leave it on for three or four or five or seven days. And sometimes it is left on for twenty days according to how well the limb has healed and the fracture has joined together and the flesh has healed over it.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then tighten the binding a little more than your first binding and adjust it according to how well the patient remembers it.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	But if you see the fractured area becoming dry and thin, then know that it is prohibited for nourishment to reach it; therefore moisten it with lukewarm water every three days; loosen the binding a little, and through this operation the limb will receive nourishment and heal quickly.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	But what the foolish restorers of a broken limb do is another way when it has not healed at the beginning according to how it should have, and it is healed crookedly according to their operation; therefore it is a great error according to their operation and a great fear, and if they had known this they would have made a much better cure.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen any of them do that, for it is more reasonable that they not do so.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter two: Of fractures when they occur in the head
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The types of fractures are many, and their shapes are diverse, and their causes are distinct; for some fractures are caused by the impact of a heavy object, and the impact goes through the whole bone, breaking it as it goes, just like it does to a log, and for this reason that type of fracture is called a split fracture; or the heavy object hits only one part of the bone and breaks into the flesh but does not go through to the other side, and for this reason this type of fracture is called a simple fracture.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the size of the fracture is either large or small, and it may be narrow or broad; and the cause of it is impact from a stone or fall on a rock, and their likenesses.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture may be penetrating so that it approaches the membrane that is below the bone; or it may be in the face of the bone, and the size of these two fractures may be large or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And another type of fracture is that which occurs in the bone, in the thinness of the hair, and for this reason it is called a hairline fracture.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And there is another fracture that occurs from falling or being hit by a stone and its likenesses, when a thin layer of the bone is forced into the openings within it, and this occurs in concave places just like it does to the fingers when they are hit and their tips are forced inward.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And most often this happens to the bones of bent bodies, like the skulls of infants.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And all these types of fractures are set in such a way that they are separated from each other.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And you will remember all this in its place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And you will know all these types of fractures by detection of them and by inquiry into their likenesses, and by examination of the rotten flesh that is above them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	And hairline fractures are known by their appearance when the flesh is pulled back from the bone and washed clean; for then the fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	But in the treatment of fractures you should first consider the signs of the patient, and then if you see any signs that clearly show fear, like vomiting from cholera, or extension, or loss of understanding, or loss of voice, or fainting, or acute fever, or sweating and heat in those parts, and likenesses to them from the major dispositions, then he will not heal.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	But if you do not see these signs, then you should begin his cure.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The cause of this is that if the fracture has occurred at the beginning in the winter days, then you should study the healing of the bone over the course of fourteen days according to its entire disposition.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is in the summer days, then you should let the bone be bound for seven days, so that what is below the membrane can be corrupted by it, and so that the signs we have mentioned occur.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has already reached the membrane and covered the brain, and it is narrow and sharp, then you should wet the sharp edge according to what I have told you.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And you should wash the head of the patient who is fractured, and uncover it according to custom and in a way that is possible for you according to the shape of the fracture, and so that it is loose on the patient.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if you see the detection of the bone, or bleeding or an abscess, then you should stop it with what occurs, and so that humors flow from the wound into a cloth soaked in wine and rose oil, and let the fracture rest so that the abscess is relieved, and then begin the girding of the bone and its healing.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And this should be done according to one of two ways of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the first way is that you insert the bone with a narrow instrument, and this is its shape: And then you administer another instrument, one slightly broader than the first; and this is its shape:
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And the other way is that you insert the bone through penetration with a narrow instrument, and this is its shape; and then you administer the broader instrument.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	And you should have several instruments of different widths, some of which are broader than others, and some are narrower, and some are acute in the end, and made of iron or steel.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And they have ease of use in percussion on the scalp to prevent concussion and lead him to that.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	And if the bone is strong and hard, then you must pierce through its surface before administering the scalpels, which are called non-deep scalpels.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are not named like this except that they do not reach the bone of the skull to what is right next to it, so that the scalpel has a rounded tip or edge below the sharp tip of it, which prohibits being submerged and passing through the thickness of the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is convenient that you take many of these scalpels, each one according to the thickness of each bone, so that they are present in all skulls of the brain, whose end is sharp, and the amount in length and brevity is according to the thickness of this skull.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	And this is the form of three species of scalpels: The quality of piercing through the broken bone is that you place the scalpel on the bone and turn it with your fingers so that you know that the bone has been penetrated; then change the scalpel to another place, and pause where there is a quantity of thickness of the vein or around it.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And then incision with scalpels what is between each crack of the bone, and make that as subtle as you can on top of it at the end of elevation, thus as we have said, so that you radiate the bone, or by your hand, or by any other cause by some instruments which you will have prepared for this, such as tweezers and subtle forceps.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And be sure to keep the incision away from any cause of the brain.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And then when you have pierced the bone and separated it from the brain if it is continued with it, and you will have extracted that, scrape and gnaw that in its roughness with another instrument similar to an incision, but however, let it be more thin and more subtle than the other scalpels.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if you pull out some of the small bones and threads, then take that with ease from what is due to you from the instruments; then cure the wound with lint and bandages which we have said.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the other manner of operation is lighter, distant from fear, which Galien and Lauzeck praised for great praise; and this is their speech about it: it is necessary for you in the beginning to begin to uncover the part of the bone of the place where there is the most violent and most manifest fracture, so that when you have uncovered that part and placed below it the tip of this scalpel slow and gentle, of which this is the form:
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And the lenticular part is round and does not insert into any cause, and the acute part is of it in two sides in length, as well as a wedge; let the lenticular part be applied to the brain with the sharp face of it inserted into the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	And then percute on the scalpel of one part with a small hammer so that you insert all the bone with ease as it is turned, and be sure of the membrane that it does not happen to him accidentally, and if the patient was the most foolish of all men and the most ignorant of them; certainly, and if he was sleeping.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	Then if he removes any cause attached to the bone of the membrane in some places of bones, cut that from it with the tip of the lenticular scalpel, and free that from it with ease, because it is freed from him without harm and fear.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	And if the fracture of the bone does not penetrate into the membrane, and what is cut off or remains of the bone is the face of it, and pulls in it roughness and subtle threads, then scrape that roughness and gnaw those threads with subtle razors by which you have prepared their number, of different quantities so that it is possible for you to administer them in every place most conveniently, and according to what place you are performing your operation on that broken bone.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And be sure to administer in your reason with which you scrape the bone at the beginning of the most side of those razors, and then use that most subtle one, and do not cease to do that according to continuity until you come to administer the most thin and the most subtle of all of them.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	But in any other small capillary fractures and subtle fracture, be sure to cure it according to what you come to rectify it.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	And it is a cause that is not hidden from all those who have studied in that art.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And we have written about what we have shown in great fractures.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	And if the membrane is extended when you radiate the bone, then take cloth according to the quantity of the wound, and soak it in rose oil, and place it over the hole of the wound; then take another cloth folded or doubled and soak it in wine and rose oil and place it over the first cloth and do that as gently as you can so that you do not weigh down the brain; then administer over that bandage with fat length, and do not tighten it except for the quantity that the wound has so much only.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	And leave that with this cure for a day or two so that you are sure of cauterized pus; then loosen it and then administer medicines with which there is excessive dryness, such as linen rags and errhines of linseed, and powder of aniseeds and aristology, and of similar things to those.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And it is that you make of these medicines powder which is sprinkled over the wound, as they are dried; and universally, administer in that all medicine of property of which there is one that cleanses and does not bite.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	And be careful according to your virtue that the wound in your cure is clean; and do not let there be any putrefaction or other in it; nor do you leave virulence to settle in it; because when it is applied over the membrane of the brain, it corrupts and rots it, and malevolent malice happens about the patient.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And it happens in the skull of the head, as when the bone is cleansed and most when the cure of it is diminished, and there is blackness on its surface; then consider therefore if it happens to the patient the accidents which we have said, know that it is mortal without doubt.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas .iii., e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if blackness does not happen except from the medicine which is placed over it, and it is because of that medicine that makes that blackness, then be sure to take some honey and parts of rose oil iii., and with those lines a cloth, and then place that over the skull; then cure it with the spices of cure which are convenient so that it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter iii.
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	Of restoration of the nose when it is broken.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	Know that the nose is not broken except in two parts very much uppermost, or one of those some few times, because in it there are two bones, because the part below is cartilage, and is not broken, and it does not happen to it except tension and tortuosity and sinuosity.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	But if one of the two parts of it is broken, then be sure to insert your little finger in your nose, and gnaw that fracture inside with your index finger, and with your middle finger push it outward, so that the nose returns according to its natural figure.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And do this for you with ease, and be sure that it does not hit because of your operation on the pain of them.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is in the highest part of the nose, and the patient does not perceive it, then one must make a small incision at the end of the bone where there is some thickness.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in two parts, then you should act accordingly.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	And provide treatment for him on the first day of the fracture, if possible; and if not, then return to it or wait seven days after the formation of the blister.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	Then insert a piece of linen thread into the end of the nose, if the fracture is in one part; or put two splints in, if it is in two parts, and let there be as much thickness in the splint as will fill the crack in the nose.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	And some of the ancient restorators say that the splints should be wrapped in wool, and changed every day, but this has not been seen by me; they say that the thread should be wrapped in alum-soaked linen, that the bone may be held firm, and the cartilage hardened.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	And in some cases a feather quill is inserted into the nose instead of a splint; and this should be done when the fracture is very violent, and the patient not prohibited from breathing.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	And this cause does not need you to act; and if you want to do it, then do it; and if you want to make splints, then make them.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if another blister occurs, plaster the nose with cerate or cotton soaked in wine vinegar and rose oil, or with diaquilon.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	But if a blister does not occur, then plaster that part with sesame flour and powdered onions cooked in alum vinegar; and place over it a piece of linen, and do not apply any other thing to the nose.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	But if the bones of the nose are broken with a small fracture or crushed, then cut them, and extract them with instruments appropriate to those; and close up the cut, and cure it with something that encourages flesh-growth and bone consolidation, and plaster it with convenient plasters.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	And if pus occurs within the nose, then cure that with splints and administer lead tubes to ensure complete healing.
Capitol .iiii.	Chapter 4.
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	Of the restoration of the jaw when it is dislocated.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the mandible is broken and the fracture does not have pus, then consider whether the fracture is only external, and not broken in two and curved inward at its parts; then its treatment is easier.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And therefore, if the fracture is on the right side, then insert your left index finger into the mouth of the patient; and similarly, if the fracture is on the left mandible, then insert the said index finger of the right hand; and move with that the dislocation inward at its parts with facility by means of the other hand at the part of the bone outward; decently equaling those.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the fracture of the mandible is already separated into two, then administer extension of both parts according to rightness so that its position is possible.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if disruption of teeth occurs from concussion, then strengthen those which you hope will break with silk thread or silver wire or cedar; and plaster the broken mandible with cerate, and place over it doubled linen, and over that decently made great steel plate, or a sole weight at the length of the mandible; and tie that above according to how you are prepared for its application, so that it is not destroyed.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And command the patient to use rest and quietness, and give him drink of sorbents of wine.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you judge that it has already been altered in some way, then you treat and loosen it on the third day; and correct what has been altered, and plaster it with alum vinegar, or with sesame flour, since you have removed its cerate, and place over it linen wool.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And after that, when the plaster is in place and adjusted over it, and the position of the bone is not altered, then leave it, so as not to loosen it until it is healed and the fracture strengthened; for many times this fracture is healed within three weeks.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another blister occurs, then administer what we have said several times in the treatment of it until it is healed, and let that blister be lanced.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture has pus in it, then consider whether the bone is separated or shattered; then you act subtly that you remove those shatters with whatever is appropriate for their removal.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the opening of the pus is narrow, then you enlarge it with a flebotomy according to the quantity of your need.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	And when you have removed those shatters, and if they do not ooze pus again, then close up the opening of the pus, if it is large; and if not, plaster over it one of the plasters appropriate for that, so that it encourages flesh-growth and is healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	Of the restoration of the collarbone when it is dislocated.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	Many times the clavicle in front of the breast is broken by the muscle; and that fracture is made in one of three ways.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	For it is either broken, or separated, or separated in two parts other than those which do not occur shatters; and its treatment is easier; or occurs therein shatters, and it is difficult to treat; or the fracture has pus in it.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	And its action in that, when the fracture is without pus, is that you have two agents, so that one holds the helper and follows the collarbone broken, and the other extends the collar to that part.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	And then join the fracture with your fingers within it so that its form is made according to how it should be, and there is not a little prominence or concavity in it.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	And if you need more extension, then let the patient hold under his chin a pillow or some wool, and the size of it according to the quantity of your need; and extend and raise the collarbone and stop the holding with your hand within that you join the fracture according to how it should be.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	And if you cannot draw the end of the collarbone to its parts outward, so that it is approached to the breast, then let the patient recline on his neck, and place over the muscle of it a pillow on the left in size.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	And the agent press the muscle of it to the parts below so that the bone of the collarbone is raised that which is in the breast above; and then you correct the fracture and join it with your fingers.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	But if you feel shatters of the collarbone and they are oozing, then let loose over that and extract those shatters with facility.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if it is retained in the bone, then you invent an incision of it with one of the saws which you have prepared for that, since you had paused below the collarbone the tool which serves the ciphac; and this instrument is of wood or iron, and its form is such:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	And it is similar to a chisel of which its concavity is such; and its breadth according to what you have need for it, according to the size of the bone or the weakness of it.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	But its length is according to what is possible for you in the operation; that it have two ends thus reversed, and one end be ample and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	If the wound, which you have opened when you extracted the splinters from the bone, is wide and you are sure that there is no abscess, then you stitch together the two lips of the wound.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the wound is small, or you fear an abscess, then you fill the wound with lint and powder according to the size of the wound.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if there is an abscess, then pour wine, honey, and rose oil onto it and place a poultice over the area.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	But the binding of the bone when there is no wound or fracture, is that you place a plaster made of wheat flour and egg white, and place a poultice over it; then place lion's blood under the plaster, and then place honey underneath if it is infected; then take a strip of turpentine resin as long as the finger, which has a width of three fingers, and wrap that in linen; also, place the powder on top of the poultice and the plaster; then take a wooden stake as thin as possible whose width is that of three fingers and length similar; then wrap that in cloth, and wrap that cloth with the stake onto the fracture site; then apply honey all around, and wrap it onto the patient's neck and under his armpit on both sides, and reduce it to its original position; and when you see that the fracture is healing well, and no swelling remains, then there is nothing more for you to do.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	Also, make sure that the stake is not pushing against the broken bone; and therefore, when you see the patient every day, if you notice that the ligament has loosened or the stake appears to be pushing out, then rectify it and tighten the binding.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	Then place the pillow under his neck and another pillow underneath his head, on which he should sleep at night; in such a way that by this means, the shoulder on that side is raised, and therefore the fracture of the collarbone is also elevated above the level of the muscle; or his arm on that side is pulled up towards his neck.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	Do not loosen the binding unless there is pus or an abscess within twelve days.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	And then renew the plaster if you see that his face is changing due to it; and tighten the binding, and restore him until he is restored and the fracture of the collarbone is coagulated.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And it is strengthened and encouraged according to the month in twenty-eight days; and sometimes in some people, it is done within less time than that.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6:
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	On the restoration of a shoulder fracture.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The spatula is broken on its broad side and not on its edges.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And therefore when it is broken — and it is broken in its middle part — and it is not known except by touch, then according to the shape of the fracture you prepare it and reduce it according to the natural figure in every way that is possible for you.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	Then place onto the site powdered wheat flour and egg white, and lion's blood; then place a double-layered piece of linen; also place over that a wooden stake as thin as possible according to the width of the spatula or more.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	But if under the stake is a hollow space in one of the places of the spatula, then fill that hollow with lion's blood and then raise the stake according to its equality.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	Then tighten it above with long honey and decent constriction, and with the firmness of the stake so that it is not pushed out from its site.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	And consider the binding every day; and whenever it becomes loose, make it tighter again and adjust the stake if it is pushed out from its site.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	And keep the patient on his unaffected side.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	And the spatula is restored in twenty days or in twenty-fifth.
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	And therefore when this number is completed, then you dissolve the binding; and know that it is of the bones from which the beginning is not feared nor their dissolution.
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if it progresses from the bone's site and you place a weight under it, then you split it, and remove it, and proceed according to what we have said in the fracture of the collarbone regarding an abscess.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7:
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	On the restoration of a leg fracture.
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	The leg sometimes is broken in its middle part and this is usually the case; but its ends are often not joined and comminuted.
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	And regarding its accidents when the middle is broken it inclines to the inner parts and there occurs great pain in it, and difficulty in walking, and coughing, and strong vomiting and bleeding; and a cavity is declared in the broken bone and it does not remain hidden from feeling.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	And its restoration is that the patient should be laid on his back, and place a cushion between their shoulders; and press against their muscles, and adjust their ribs with the hands of two people, and gently in the operation and in the adjustment according to every way that is possible and convenient for it, so that the figure of the bone returns according to how it should be.
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	Then place onto it plaster and lint, and over that a thin stake of ash or of lime, or similar, after you have wrapped that in linen; also gently bend that over the broken bone so that it is not pushed out; and go around it with binding according to its roundness on the back sometimes, and tighten that with decent constriction; and consider the binding every hour, and when it becomes loose, tighten it.
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	And if it causes detachment due to swelling or pain, or an abscess that occurs in the site, then you cut and loosen it, and remove the plaster and adjust what has occurred due to its way of curing; and then return the binding, if there is a change in his face; and tighten him so that he is healed.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8:
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	On the restoration of ribs when they are cracked.
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	Know that the fracture of ribs does not occur except in large sites that go along the back; and from their ends in front, it does not occur to them unless they are cartilaginous.
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	And its knowledge is not hidden from feeling due to the inquiry with fingers.
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	And its restoration is that it should be joined with fingers according to the possible way so that it is swallowed according to how it should be; and then plaster and tighten the broken bone with a stake if it requires it.
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	And if the fracture of the ribs inclines to the inner parts, then there occurs to the patient violent pain and piercing, also with piercing that occurs where it has pleaded, and because of this there is difficulty in walking, and coughing, and vomiting blood; and this is of difficult curing.
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	And the Aンティクス have been applied to it with very heated instruments.
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	And from them there is issued: that one should stop foods for the patient that cause inflammation and fullness, so that the belly is flattened and extended, and the fracture is driven to the outer parts.
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	But we abstain from this so that it is not the cause of gout, if it has not occurred; and if it has occurred, then let us help it.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	And they will order some of them that it should be stopped over the wound and that it sucks with strength; and it is like reasoning, but it is feared that the wind draws away the superfluities to the site due to weakness.
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	And they said among themselves: whoever is in charge of the patient, let him be covered with wool that has been soaked in hot oil, and let there be powder placed between his ribs where it can be filled, so that the binding is as round as a ball; and let the patient be treated with poultices of food and medicine.
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	And if there is a violent constriction that the patient cannot endure, and the bones puncture the veil with their teeth, they fear for the patient; therefore, whoever incises over the affected area, exposes the broken rib, and places upon it an instrument that retains the phlegm, the memory of which precedes, and incises the bone with ease to extract it.
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	And then, sew up the two lips of the wound, if it is large, with a stitch, and treat it with poultices until it is healed.
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	And if there is an abscess inside, then cut and pour powder in warm oil over the area; and let the patient be treated with something that treats the abscess inside.
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	And let him sleep on his back until he is healed.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9:
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	On the restoration of a fracture of the spine and of the neck.
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	Sometimes there is a fracture in the bones of the neck, and they rub against each other with pain, and similarly in the vertebrae of the back.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	And when this happens to someone and you want to know if they will be healed or not, then consider the following: If their bones are already soft and stupid and dead and cannot move or bend any more, and when you press them with your fingers or prick them with a needle and there is no pain, then know that they will not be healed, and in most cases it is lethal.
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	And if they are painful and there is a constriction when you press them or prick them, then know that the neck of the bone is saved and the patient will be healed with treatment.
E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	And if you see something similar in the vertebrae of the neck and want to know if they will be healed or not, then consider his feet.
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu.	Now, if you see that they are already soft and there is something similar to what happened in the bones; and if when he lies on his back, he experiences windiness and involuntary defecation, and sometimes he lies on his back and wants to urinate but cannot, then know that it is lethal and you should not continue with his treatment.
Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	But if none of these things happen, the prognosis is better and recovery is more likely.
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	And the treatment for him is to apply a poultice of hot oil to the abscess on the fractured vertebra with cauterized wool or with flowers of hound's tongue, and to apply it sometimes during the day as long as the abscess is suppurating.
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	And then apply one of the comforting and soothing poultices; and strengthen it with a bandage, and instruct the patient to take rest and tranquility and not to sleep on the side that causes him pain until he is healed.
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	And if there is a separation of the bones due to some cause, then cut and dry the cord, and let them put it on the bone; and then sew up the two lips of the wound with a stitch if it is large, and treat it with something that encourages the growth of new flesh until it is healed.
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l’autra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	But if the end of the bone is broken and it is the end of the spine, then let him insert his left index finger into the anus, and hold together the broken bone with his right hand as much as possible due to the second condition; and then apply a poultice over it and splint it, if there are any signs of pain, and then bind it.
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	And if you feel that the bones are broken in him, then cut and dry over it, hold it, and treat the wound with what has been mentioned until it is healed.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10:
De restauracio de la ancha.	On the restoration of a hernia.
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura.	The bones of the hips are often fractured, and when they are broken, their fracture is not only in their extremities but also in their length, and they decline towards each other; and there is pain and puncturing in the patient at that location, and the leg is stunned when it is fractured.
E la restauracio de lu es que tu extendas la tua ma sobre aquel entro que sia sobre la fractura qual es la figura de lu.	And its restoration is for you to extend your hand over it so that it lies over the fracture in the same way as its shape.
E si fractura es en la extremitat de lu tant solament, lahoras tu enguala aquela segon que a tu es apparelhat per equacio engual entro que sia asemblat a la sua figura natural.	And if it is fractured at its end only, then hold it together according to what appears appropriate to you through an equal binding so that it is similar in shape to its natural form.
Mays si la fractura es en le lonc o que ja declina a las partidas dejos, lahoras tu fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu ventre entro que sia preparada a tu la restauracio de aquela fractura.	But if the fracture is in its length and it inclines towards the feet, then let the patient lie on his belly so that you can restore that fracture.
E donc quan auras engualada aquela, pausa sobre lu emplastre, e aprop pausa sobre aquel astela de fust o de codena, e strenh per strictura sobre la qual no temas punctacio de fractura ni remocio de la stelha.	And when you have bound it, apply a poultice over it, and then place over it a splint of wood or cord, and bind it tightly so that you do not fear the puncturing of the fracture or the removal of the splint.
E enguala la concavitat am aquo que uempla aquela entro que aquela prengua la strictura segon equalitat, e comanda al malaute que dorma sobre le sieu dos o desobre le sieu costat sa.	And hold the cavity with something that fills it so that it takes on the binding according to its equality, and instruct the patient to sleep on his back or on his side.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu cessa de extencio de lu e de la sua restauracio entro que sia sedat le apostema caut, e pausa sobre lu aquo que sede aquel segon que es precedit; e aprop retorna a la restauracio de lu, e strenh aquel ayssi cum cove.	But if there is an abscess, then stop its extension and its restoration until the abscess is suppurating, and apply over it what has been mentioned before; and then return to its restoration, and bind it in the same way as previously described.
E si accideysso en le os satagias o son comminuidas, lahoras tu las tratz.	And if they are broken or crushed, then treat them.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11:
De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	On the restoration of a fracture of the elbow.
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	The elbow is what is between the shoulder and the head.
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	And if it is fractured, then its restoration is in one of two ways, and the first is that you take wood of a medium thickness according to this form:
E sian liatz en doas extremitatz dos liamentz, e aprop sia suspendut del loc elevat.	And let it be tied at its two ends with two threads, and then let it be suspended from the raised location.
E segua le malaute sobre una sezela; e aprop gieta fora le sieu bras trencat sobre le fust entro que pervengua al titillic de lu en le mieg loc del qual sia annexa la curvitat del fust.	And let the patient lean on one of his hands; and then let him bend his broken arm over the wood so that it reaches the tip of the wood at the location where the wood is attached to the curve of the wood.
E aprop suspen sobre aquel alcuna causa greu, o·l minestre extenda aquel a las partidas dejos; e aprop le metge eque la fractura am las sieuas mas ensemps, entro que la fractura retorne segon que cove.	And then suspend it with some heavy weight, or let the servant extend it towards its sides; and then let the doctor and his assistants press the fracture with their hands, so that the fracture returns as it was before.
E l’autra manieyra es que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sieua cervitz e suspen la ma del col de lu am liament; e aprop comanda a dos ministres que la un de lor tengua aquo que es desobre la fractura am las suas mas; e l’autre tengua le pus dejos de lu; e quascu de lor extenda a la sua partida.	And the other way is for the patient to lie on his neck and suspend the arm of the collarbone with a bandage; and then let two servants hold one of them holding what is over the fracture with their hands, and the other the patient's feet, and each of them extend it towards its side.
E si voles que la extencio sia pus fort, lahoras tu strenh sobre la fractura am liament e sobre aquela am autre liament, e quascu dels dos ministres extendan a doas suas partidas.	And if you want the extension to be stronger, then bind over the fracture with a bandage and another one over that, and each of the two servants extend it towards its two sides.
E donc si la fractura es propinquada a la extremitat del muscle, lahoras cove que sia pausat la mitat del liament sobre le citillic e l’autre dejos la fractura deves le coyde.	And if the fracture is close to the end of the muscle, then let half of the bandage be over the tip and the other under the fracture towards the shoulder.
E semblantment si la fractura es propdana al coyde, lahoras cove que sia pausat le liament sobre aquel loc e sobre aquel coyde.	And similarly, if it is close to the shoulder, then let the bandage be over that location and over the shoulder.
Enguala aquela am facilitat e ses trebal, e aprop quant sira engualada segon que cove e es applicada per bona applicacio, lahoras strenh aquela si no accideys apostema caut.	Hold it with ease and without pain, and then when it is bound according to its shape and there is no abscess, then bind it tightly if there is no abscess.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras layssa la strictura entro al vii dia, e pausa sobre lu lana sutza enbeguda en vi agre e oli rozat entro que repause le apostema, e lahoras tu stren aquela.	But if there is an abscess, then loosen it on the seventh day, and apply over it wool soaked in vinegar and warm oil so that the abscess is suppurating, and then bind it tightly.
E la manieyra de strenher aquela es que pauses emplastre sobre la fractura, e aprop pausa envolopament de drap nau sobre le emplastre; e aprop ajuste le bras sobre aquel adjutori, e pause la sua ma uberta sobre le sieu muscle.	And the manner of strengthening that is to place a plaster over the fracture, and then place a wrapping of new cloth over the plaster; and then adjust the arm onto that support, and place your open hand over his muscle.
E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	And place the cloth and strengthen the support for the arm so that the arm is in place of the broken bone, unless prohibited by any cause of the broken bone.
E lahoras usa de stelhas.	And then use splints.
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	And it is that you place over the fracture that splint which is wider and stronger than the others; and place between each splint the width of your finger, and let the length of the splints be according to the break with an addition of three fingers of all together.
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	And then strengthen over the splints with that binding which has been said at the beginning of this chapter.
E es que la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura sia pus streyt.	And it is that your binding over the site of the fracture be more tight.
E quant pus es alonguada la fractura sia la strictura menor.	And when the fracture is longer, let the binding be shorter.
E donc si vezes le situament de las stelas e la strictura ayssi cum havem dit en la hora en la qual restauras le membre al sieu assituament, lahoras tu fay.	And therefore if you see the placement of the splints and binding as we have said in the time when you restore the limb to its position, then do as follows:
E si temes apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la strictura e las stelas entro al dia vii ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you fear an ulcer, then you should leave off the binding and splints for seven days as we have said.
E aprop considera le liament en totas partidas per tres dias per so que no accida en le loc pruziment o imflacio; o es prohibida la vianda pervenir al membre per disposicio de superfluitat de strictura; e donc rectifiqua tot aquo segon que havem dit.	And then consider the ligament in all parts for three days so that no swelling or inflammation occur in the area; or it is prohibited that food come to the limb due to excess of binding; and therefore rectify all that according to what has been said.
Mays si tu yest sobre confizanssa que no accida alcuna causa de aquo, lahoras no deslias la liguadura sino aprop tres dias o mays.	But if you are certain that no such cause will occur, then do not loosen the binding but rather three days or more.
E sia la sua dormicio del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e las sieuas mas sian sobre le stomac.	And let the patient's sleep be on his back, and let his hands be over his stomach.
E pausa sobre le adjutori cocena plena de lana engualment, e considera en tota hora de la nueyt o del dia que no sia deliada ni dissolta la figura del membre trencat, o que sia le liament mollificat, donc rectifica aquo tot am la tua vertut.	And place over the support a poultice full of wool soaked in water, and consider throughout the night or day that the figure of the broken limb is not deflated nor dissolved, or that the binding be softened; therefore rectify all with your skill.
E pausa la vianda del malaute segon le orde le qual havem denant mes, enayssi que la vianda sia subtil en le comensament entro que es comensat strenher; e lahoras cove que egrossas la vianda de lu.	And give the patient food according to the order which we have mentioned before, so that the food be subtle in the beginning as it is commenced strengthening; and then cover that he grows fat.
Quar de constuma del adjutori e de la camba de lu es que sian strengutz en xl dias; e lahoras cove que sian desliatz e sia administrat banh e sia medicat am enguentz los quals rectifican aquel.	For it is customary for the support and his bed to be tightened for 40 days; and then cover that they be loosened and a bath be administered and he be medicated with ointments which rectify that.
E si la fractura es layha atrita, lahoras tu no deslies de aquela le liament e las stelhas entro a l dias o entro a dos meses.	And if the fracture is white, then you should not loosen that binding and splints for 15 days or two months.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter .12.
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	Of restoration of a fracture in the arm.
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	An arm is made up of two bones which are called two radii; one of which is small, and it is that which the thumb presses, and the other is large and is that which is pressed below by the small finger, in the part lower down.
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	And often only the larger radius is broken, or the smaller, and often they are both broken together.
